original: sems can 'di dag kyang de ltar gyur cig snyam ste /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag kyang de ltar gyur cig snyam ste /

original: btang snyoms la snyoms par zhugs pas /
analyzed: btang snyoms la snyoms par zhugs pas /
translated: Thus, by entering into equanimity,

original: ci yang med pa'i skye mched de nye bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched de nye bar sgrub par byed do //

analyzed: de bas na ci yang med pa'i skye mched nye bar bsgrubs pas yongs su bsgoms pa'i btang snyoms mchog yin te /

analyzed: 'phags pa'i rnam pa byang chub kyi yan lag dang ldan pa 'di dag thams cad ni /

analyzed: cha gcig bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na / gang la snang ba'i mtshan ma'am /

analyzed: yang na gzugs kyi mtshan ma yid la byas nas snyoms par 'jug pa ste /

analyzed: de gnyis kyis go rims bzhin du snang ba yang dag par shes pa'am /

original: yang na gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na gzugs mthong bar 'gyur ba'o //

original: gnyis ka'i cha bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i cha bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /

analyzed: gnyis ka yid la byas nas snyoms par 'jug ste /

original: des ni snang ba yang dag par shes la /
analyzed: des ni snang ba yang dag par shes la /
translated: By this, one perceives light and

original: gzugs rnams kyang mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs rnams kyang mthong ngo //

original: de ltar snang ba yongs su bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba yongs su bsgoms pa'i ting nge 'dzin la ni /

analyzed: the tshom la sogs pas rnam pa bcu gcig bar du gcod par rig par bya ste /

analyzed: mdo las rgya cher ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //

original: de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma gang la sgrib ce na /
analyzed: de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma gang la sgrib ce na /

analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan ma dang / gzhi'i mtshan ma rnam pa gnyi ga la yang @146a * //

analyzed: sgrib ste / gang la brten nas ting nge 'dzin gnas par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma de las nyams na gnas par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: de la thog mar ma bsams par gzugs snang ba mthong ba las ni the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: brtson pa lhod pa las ni yid la mi byed par 'gyur te /

analyzed: dper na gzugs rnams la lta bar mi 'dod pa ni / yang na mig 'dzums par byed dam /

analyzed: de yang gzugs de dag yid la mi byed par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa la sogs pa ni lus kyi gnas ngan len du 'gyur ro //
translated: Not guarding the doors of the senses, etc., is a physical fault.

original: ha cang gnyid ma log pa'am /
analyzed: ha cang gnyid ma log pa'am /
translated: Not sleeping enough or

original: yang na gnyid bsten drags pas ni glong ste /
analyzed: yang na gnyid bsten drags pas ni glong ste /

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes drowsy and sleepy.

original: gzugs rnams mi mthong ngam /
analyzed: gzugs rnams mi mthong ngam /
translated: One does not see forms or

original: yang na tshang bar mi mthong ba la /
analyzed: yang na tshang bar mi mthong ba la /
translated: one does not see them completely.

original: ha cang brtun ngas pa'i nyes pas ni ha cang zhum par byed de /
analyzed: ha cang brtun ngas pa'i nyes pas ni ha cang zhum par byed de /

original: bya khug rta btsir ba bzhin no /
analyzed: bya khug rta btsir ba bzhin no /
translated: like a quail that is over-coaxed.

original: de snang ba tsam zhig 'dod pa las /
analyzed: de snang ba tsam zhig 'dod pa las /

original: gzugs mthong ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ste /üîΩgcig 'dod pa las gnyis rnyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba dang lhan cig tu 'byung ste / gcig 'dod pa las gnyis rnyed pa'i phyir /

analyzed: gnyer gyi sgo gnyis rnyed pa bzhin du /
translated: it is like obtaining two things by opening two doors of a chest.

original: shin tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu dga' bar 'gyur ro //

original: glo bur du phyogs kun tu gzugs bzang po cig car mthong na sngar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: glo bur du phyogs kun tu gzugs bzang po cig car mthong na sngar bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one suddenly sees a beautiful form in all directions, one is happy.

original: glo gnyi ga nas sreg par 'phur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: glo gnyi ga nas sreg par 'phur ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like a bird flying from both wings.

original: de 'gro yang rung gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de 'gro yang rung gnas kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether one is walking or standing,

original: 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs dag la 'du shes sna tshogs su 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi sna tshogs dag la 'du shes sna tshogs su 'gyur na /

original: phyi rol du 'du shes pa de ni de'i ting nge 'dzin la bar du gcod par byed do //
analyzed: phyi rol du 'du shes pa de ni de'i ting nge 'dzin la bar du gcod par byed do //
translated: those perceptions are an obstacle to concentration.

original: yang na ting nge 'dzin des bdag nyid ni mchog tu mthong la /
analyzed: yang na ting nge 'dzin des bdag nyid ni mchog tu mthong la /
translated: Or, if one thinks that one‚Äôs own concentration is superior

original: gzhan ni dma' bar bdag nyid kun tu 'dzin par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan ni dma' bar bdag nyid kun tu 'dzin par byed na /
translated: and that others‚Äô is inferior,

original: de yang 'du shes sna tshogs yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'du shes sna tshogs yin no //
translated: that is also a variety of perception.

original: ha cang smra ba la brtson pa'am /
analyzed: ha cang smra ba la brtson pa'am /

original: yang na ha cang yun ring du rtog pa las ni lus ngal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang na ha cang yun ring du rtog pa las ni lus ngal bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if one reflects too long, the body becomes tired.

original: sems kyang ting nge 'dzin du mi rung bas na /
analyzed: sems kyang ting nge 'dzin du mi rung bas na /
translated: And the mind is not fit for concentration.

original: ha cang smra ba mang na yang bar du gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: ha cang smra ba mang na yang bar du gcod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, excessive speech is an obstacle.

original: de nas snang ba'i mtshan ma dang / gzugs snang ba byung na yang /
analyzed: de nas snang ba'i mtshan ma dang / gzugs snang ba byung na yang /
translated: Then, if the sign of light and the appearance of form arise,

original: nang gi rnal 'byor la 'jug pa'i yid la byed @146b pa bor nas /
analyzed: nang gi rnal 'byor la 'jug pa'i yid la byed @146b pa bor nas /
translated: one should apply the attention of engaging inner yoga.

original: phyi rol du 'jug par byed cing /
analyzed: phyi rol du 'jug par byed cing /
translated: One should not engage in external things.

original: gzugs rnams la rtog par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs rnams la rtog par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: One should not reflect on forms.

original: mngon par rtogs pa de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa de yang ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa ste /
translated: That realization is an obstacle to concentration.

original: 'di dag ni mthun mthun du ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa dang / gzhi la bar du gcod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di dag ni mthun mthun du ting nge 'dzin gyi dmigs pa dang / gzhi la bar du gcod par rig par bya ste /
translated: These are to be known as obstacles to the object of concentration and to the basis of concentration, respectively.

original: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du dmigs pa dang / gzhi'i mtshan ma rnams las nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang go rims bzhin du dmigs pa dang / gzhi'i mtshan ma rnams las nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They cause the loss of the sign of the object and the sign of the basis, respectively.

original: kha cig ni gnyi ga'i mtshan ma las nyams par byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni gnyi ga'i mtshan ma las nyams par byed do //
translated: Some cause the loss of both signs.

original: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: dga' ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi associated with joy?

original: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dang gnyis pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the samadhi of the first and second Dhyanas.

original: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi associated with pleasure?

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'o //
translated: It is the samadhi of the third Dhyana.

original: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: btang snyoms dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the samadhi associated with indifference?

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad do //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa yan chad do //
translated: It is the samadhi of the fourth Dhyana and of the formless realms.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na /üîΩtshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi po rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam la ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang yin pa'am /üîΩdngos gzhi yongs su ma dag cing /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa bzhi po rnams kyi sbyor ba'i lam la ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang yin pa'am / dngos gzhi yongs su ma dag cing /
translated: What is the cultivation of samadhi which leads to happiness in this life?

original: yongs su ma byang ba rnams la ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma byang ba rnams la ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of samadhi on the path of application of the four kinds of happiness in this life, or the cultivation of samadhi in the principal part which is not completely purified and not completely cleansed.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ma byung ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i don du bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i lam gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis sngon ma byung ba la snyoms par 'jug pa'i don du bsam gtan dang po la sbyor ba'i lam gsungs so //
translated: The Blessed One has declared the path of application of the first Dhyana for the sake of entering the samadhi which has not yet arisen.

original: ye shes mthong ba thob par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ye shes mthong ba thob par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the samadhi which attains the vision of knowledge?

original: de la dge slong gis snang ba'i mtshan ma legs par rab tu shin tu bzung bar gyur ces bya ba mdo las byung ba bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de la dge slong gis snang ba'i mtshan ma legs par rab tu shin tu bzung bar gyur ces bya ba mdo las byung ba bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Here, a bhiksu, having well grasped, well penetrated, well understood the sign of light, should practice as stated in the sutra.

original: de nyid ni lha'i mig mngon par bsgrub pa'i sbyor pa'i lam las blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni lha'i mig mngon par bsgrub pa'i sbyor pa'i lam las blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as the path of application for the realization of the divine eye.

original: de la lha'i mig gis gzugs rnams la lta zhing /
analyzed: de la lha'i mig gis gzugs rnams la lta zhing /
translated: There, the vision of forms by means of the divine eye,

original: mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o //üîΩ'di ltar lha de dag ni /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa gang yin pa de ni mthong ba'o // 'di ltar lha de dag ni /
translated: and the direct realization of them is seeing.

original: ming 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: ming 'di zhes bya /
translated: Thus, the knowledge of the names of those gods,

original: rigs ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya bar shes pa gang yin pa /
analyzed: rigs ni 'di zhes bya zhes bya bar shes pa gang yin pa /
translated: and the knowledge of their families,

original: lha'i ched du gsungs pa'i mdo las rgya cher 'byung ba de ni ye shes so //
analyzed: lha'i ched du gsungs pa'i mdo las rgya cher 'byung ba de ni ye shes so //
translated: as stated in the sutra spoken by the gods, is knowledge.

original: shes rab rab tu dbye bar 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab rab tu dbye bar 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the cultivation of the samadhi which becomes the analysis of wisdom?

original: sbyor ba'i lam la bden pa mngon par rtogs par rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang @147a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la bden pa mngon par rtogs par rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu dang / so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang @147a * //
translated: The concentration of the path of application is the cultivation of the fruit of stream-entry and the cultivation of the analytical knowledges.

original: yin pa'o // zag pa zad par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yin pa'o // zag pa zad par 'gyur ba'i ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration of the destruction of the impurities?

original: sbyor ba'i lam la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam la dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the cultivation of the fruit of Arhatship on the path of application.

original: 'phags pa'i shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gang zhe na /
translated: What is the concentration of the five superknowledges of the noble ones?

original: bdag gi ting nge 'dzin 'di ni 'phags pa zang zing med pa /
analyzed: bdag gi ting nge 'dzin 'di ni 'phags pa zang zing med pa /
translated: This concentration of mine is noble, free from the world,

original: phung po med pa zhes mdo las rgya cher 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po med pa zhes mdo las rgya cher 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: not included in the aggregates, as is stated in the sutra.

original: des shes pa lnga yongs su bstan te /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: des shes pa lnga yongs su bstan te / 'di lta ste /
translated: It is taught that there are five knowledges:

original: ngo bo nyid dang / gang zag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / 'bras bu dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ldang ba'i mtshan ma rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / gang zag dang / yongs su dag pa dang / 'bras bu dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / ldang ba'i mtshan ma rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: the knowledge of the nature of things, the knowledge of the person, the knowledge of purification, the knowledge of the fruits, and the knowledge of the signs of entry into concentration and emergence from concentration.

original: de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is the noble path?

original: dge ba'i 'phags pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i phyir ro //üîΩzang zing med pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i 'phags pa nyid du ston par byed do //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'phags pa dang / zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa'i phyir ro // zang zing med pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i 'phags pa nyid du ston par byed do //
translated: because it is the virtue of the noble ones and the uncontaminated virtue of the noble ones.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúwithout materiality‚Äù shows that it is the virtue of the noble ones.

original: phung po med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: phung po med pa zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i 'phags pa nyid du'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout aggregates‚Äù shows that it is the uncontaminated virtue of the noble ones.

original: skyes bu ngan pa ma yin pas bsten pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / de'i nyan thos rnams kyis bsten pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu ngan pa ma yin pas bsten pa zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sangs rgyas rnams dang / de'i nyan thos rnams kyis bsten pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is the practice of the good person‚Äù shows that it is the practice of the noble buddhas and their disciples.

original: shes pa rnams kyis bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyis bsngags pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid kyis so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is praised by the wise‚Äù shows that it is praised by those very ones.

original: shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du bsngags pa ste /üîΩdper na bsam gtan dang po ni gong du 'gro bar brtson pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa rnams kyis ma smad pa zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du bsngags pa ste / dper na bsam gtan dang po ni gong du 'gro bar brtson pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúit is not censured by the wise‚Äù shows that it is praised at all times.

original: sngar zhi ba'o zhes bsngags la /
analyzed: sngar zhi ba'o zhes bsngags la /
translated: For example, the first meditative absorption is praised as ‚Äúpeaceful‚Äù because it is the practice of those who strive for the higher realms.

original: phyis ni rags pa'o zhes rnam par smad pa de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis ni rags pa'o zhes rnam par smad pa de lta bu ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not censured as ‚Äúcoarse‚Äù later on.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Tranquility is because the afflictions that are its counteragents are pacified.

original: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis pa'i nyon mongs pas ro myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro//üîΩshin tu sbyangs pa'i lam thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gya nom pa zhes bya ba ni rang gis pa'i nyon mongs pas ro myong bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro// shin tu sbyangs pa'i lam thob pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Sublime is because it does not savor its own intrinsic nature.

original: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i lam thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtaining the path of thorough purification is because one obtains the path that does not degenerate.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa med pa dang dpyod pa med pa'i sa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Obtaining the one-pointed mind is because one obtains the stage that is free from initial and sustained thought.

original: da ltar byung ba ni bde ba zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni bde ba zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Present happiness is because one abides in happiness in this life.

analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung bas ni thos pa las byung ba'i yang dag pa'i lta ba skyed par byed do //

analyzed: yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i bar du yongs su shes nas /

analyzed: log par lta ba la sogs pa spong ba dang / yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir spro ba skyed do //

analyzed: gang gis de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams spong ba dang / chos de dag rdzogs par bya ba de yang dag par sgrub par byed pa de ni /

analyzed: sbyor ba'i lam gyi tshe lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa skye'o //

original: de la yang dag pa'i dran pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de la yang dag pa'i dran pa gang yin pa de ni /

analyzed: dper na rdo rje ni nor bu thams cad kyi snying po yin te /

translated: The antidote that suppresses that which is to be abandoned by the path of seeing, the antidote that abandons that which is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation, and the discernment of that which is to be abandoned.

analyzed: de ni de dag gi lus bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: de la dang po ni / mi sdug pa'i sbyor ba las byung pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la brten nas /

analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kun du mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: nang gi lus kyi mi sdug pa la so sor rtog pa'o //

analyzed: de tsam gyis na mi sdug pa thams cad so sor brtags par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rnam par bsdos pa la sogs par brtags pa'i rnam @150a * //
translated: having contemplated the stages of the aspects of the corpse, etc.

analyzed: pa'i go rims kyis 'das nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhaving passed beyond‚Äù means

analyzed: mi sdug pa dang po ni nang gi lus la gnas shing 'dug pa'i mi sdug pa la so sor rtog go //

original: phyi mas ni chos nyid rtogs te /
analyzed: phyi mas ni chos nyid rtogs te /

analyzed: 'di 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par sbyar ro //
translated: and will become like that.‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyun la so sor rtog ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyun la so sor rtog ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúhe discerns the stream of consciousness‚Äù means

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ni /

original: 'jig rten pha rol kho na la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol kho na la'o //

original: dgra bcom pa ni gang la yang mi gnas par so sor rtog ste /

analyzed: 'di ni de dag gi spong pa'i so sor rtog pa'o //

translated: The spheres of mastery and the spheres of totality have already been explained.üîΩThe attainment of non-perception is the cessation of mind and mental factorsüîΩthrough the attention preceded by the perception of deliverance in one who is free from attachment to the Peak of Existence

analyzed: 'du shes ni nad lta bu'o // 'du shes ni 'bras lta bu'o //

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: He thinks:üîΩ‚ÄúThis non-perception is peaceful,

original: 'du shas med pa pa 'di ni zhi ba'o /
analyzed: 'du shas med pa pa 'di ni zhi ba'o /
translated: this is sublime.‚Äù

original: 'di ni gya nom pa'o snyam nas 'du shes @150b med pa la sems gtod pa de lta bu'i rim gyis dmigs pa thams cad las dben pa'i phyir sems 'gag ste /

analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa gang zhe na /

analyzed: ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral la / gnas pa'i 'du shes sngon du btang ba'i yid la byed pas /

analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams 'gag pa ste /

analyzed: yang na 'gog pa'i mtshan ma med pa la snyoms par zhugs kyang rung ste /

analyzed: 'gog pa snyoms par 'jug pa la chos gnyis gces spras byed pa yin te /

analyzed: de la zhi gnas ni gang yin /

analyzed: de gnyis ji ltar na gces spras byed pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: lhag mthong ni 'phags pa'i shes rab yin te /

original: thabs gang zhe na /

analyzed: gar bu de'i khro ba la sogs pa'i skyon rnam par skyangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the gold that is produced from the gem.üîΩThe purification of the lineage is

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: las dang po ba ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa de dag nyid kyi sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / bsdus ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba ma yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: las dang po ba ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa de dag nyid kyi sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / bsdus ba'i nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba ma yin du zin kyang /
translated: For those very beginners who are striving in meditative concentration, the mind is distracted and afflicted, even though it is not overcome by lethargy and sleep.

original: yid la byed pa ma thob pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gang yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ma thob pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams gang yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the mind and mental factors of those who have not attained attention.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de //
translated: There is a level that is not in equipoise because it is not fully accomplished.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: yid la byed pa thob tu zin kyang /üîΩsbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa yang ma thob /
analyzed: yid la byed pa thob tu zin kyang / sbyor ba'i mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa yang ma thob /
translated: Even though attention has been attained,üîΩthe attention that is the culmination of practice has not been attained,

original: de'i 'bras bu yang ma thob pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang ma thob pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: and the result of that has not been attained.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir mnyam bar ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a stage that is not meditative equipoise because it is thoroughly afflicted.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa thob tu zin kyang /
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa thob tu zin kyang /
translated: Even though one has attained the final stage of preparation and the attention of the result,

original: ro myang ba la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas sems nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba la sogs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gang yang rung bas sems nyon mongs pa can du gyur pa lta bu'o //
translated: the mind becomes afflicted due to any of the secondary afflictions such as relishing.

original: dbang med pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
analyzed: dbang med pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a stage that is not meditative equipoise because it lacks mastery.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa yang thob pa nyid kyi sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba med du zin kyang /üîΩsnyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / @160a * //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa dang / 'bras bu'i yid la byed pa yang thob pa nyid kyi sems la kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur ba med du zin kyang / snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang / @160a * //
translated: Even though one has attained the final stage of preparation and the attention of the result, the mind is not afflicted,

original: ldang ba'i mtshan ma rnams la dbang ma thob cing /
analyzed: ldang ba'i mtshan ma rnams la dbang ma thob cing /
translated: but one has not attained mastery over the signs of entering meditative attainment, abiding in it,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / tshegs med par ma thob pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / tshegs med par ma thob pa rnams kyi lta bu'o //
translated: and rising from it, and one has not attained them without obstruction and without difficulty as one wishes.

original: rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a stage that is not concentrated because it is impure.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ji ltar 'dod pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / tshegs med par thob tu zin kyang /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa dang / gnod pa med pa dang / tshegs med par thob tu zin kyang /
translated: even though one has attained the mundane meditative states as one wishes,

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal legs par ma choms pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi nyon mongs pa'i bag la nyal legs par ma choms pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba rnams lta bu'o //
translated: the mind and mental factors have not completely subdued the latent impressions of the afflictions.

original: rnam par langs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par langs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a stage that is not concentrated because it is active.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa las langs la yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin pa'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa las langs la yongs su nyams pa ni ma yin pa'i lta bu'o //
translated: the mind and mental factors of one who has arisen from the attainment of concentration but has not degenerated.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a stage that is not concentrated because it has degenerated.

original: 'di lta ste /üîΩting nge 'dzin thob pa las yongs su nyams pa'i lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / ting nge 'dzin thob pa las yongs su nyams pa'i lta bu'o //
translated: For example,üîΩthe mind and mental factors of one who has degenerated from the attainment of concentration.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the stage that is not concentrated from the Bodhisattvabhumi of the Yogacarabhumi.

original: // / sems yod pa dang sems med pa'i sa gang zhe na /üîΩrnam pa de gnyis la yang /
analyzed: // / sems yod pa dang sems med pa'i sa gang zhe na / rnam pa de gnyis la yang /
translated: What are the mental and nonmental levels?üîΩThere are two types of levels:üîΩmental and nonmental.

original: rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Each of these two types should be understood as having five aspects:

original: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas skabs rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / sems 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas skabs rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: the presentation of the levels, the presentation of the confused and unconfused mind, the presentation of what is and is not possible, the presentation of the situation, and the presentation of the ultimate.

original: de la sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la sar gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The presentation of the levels.

original: rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sa dang / yid kyi sa dang / rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi sa rnams ni gcig tu nges par sems yod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lnga dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sa dang / yid kyi sa dang / rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi sa rnams ni gcig tu nges par sems yod pa'o //
translated: The levels of the five consciousnesses, the mental level, and the levels of the mind with investigation and analysis, and without investigation but with analysis, are definitely only mental.

original: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i sa las ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba yod pa 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams kyi sems yod pa kho na'i sa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa'i sa las ni snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba yod pa 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams kyi sems yod pa kho na'i sa'o //
translated: The stage where there is neither ideation nor non-ideation is the stage where there is only mind, except for the attainment of cessation and the attainment of non-ideation.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba yod pa 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba yod pa 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni sems med pa'i sa'o //
translated: The attainment of non-ideation and the attainment of cessation are the stages where there is no mind.

original: de la sems 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul @160b pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: de la sems 'khrul pa dang / ma 'khrul @160b pa rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: In this regard, the mind is classified as deluded or undeluded.

original: phyin ci log bzhis sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhis sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa gang yin pa de ni 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is perverted by the four perversions is called deluded.

original: phyin ci log bzhis phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log bzhis phyin ci log tu ma gyur pa gang yin pa de ni sems ma 'khrul pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is not perverted by the four perversions is called undeluded.

original: de la sems 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni /üîΩrang bzhin las nyams pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la sems 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni / rang bzhin las nyams pa'i phyir /
translated: In this regard, the deluded mind

original: sems med pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sems med pa zhes bya ste /
translated: is called ‚Äúno-mind‚Äù because it is fallen from its intrinsic nature.üîΩThe undeluded mind is called ‚Äúmind‚Äù because it is not fallen from its intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten na smyo zhing sems 'khrul pa mthong na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten na smyo zhing sems 'khrul pa mthong na /
translated: Thus, when a person is seen in the world to be mad and confused,

original: skyes bu gang zag 'di ni sems med pa smyo ba sems 'khrugs pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gang zag 'di ni sems med pa smyo ba sems 'khrugs pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: it is said that this person is without mind, mad, and mentally disturbed.

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs des na sems 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni sems med pa'i sa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs des na sems 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni sems med pa'i sa yin la /
translated: Therefore, by this explanation, that which is confused mind is the level of no mind.

original: ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni sems yod pa yin no //
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa gang yin pa de ni sems yod pa yin no //
translated: That which is unconfused is the level of mind.

original: de la 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'byung ba dang mi 'byung ba ni /
translated: Regarding that, there is arising and non-arising.

original: rnam pa brgyad kyis sems 'byung ba'am mi 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad kyis sems 'byung ba'am mi 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: The mind arises or does not arise due to eight aspects.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dbang po yongs su nyams pa dang / yul mi snang bar gyur pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / ma thob pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / spangs pa dang / 'gags pa dang / skyes pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su nyams pa dang / yul mi snang bar gyur pa dang / yid la byed pa med pa dang / ma thob pa dang / mi mthun pa dang / spangs pa dang / 'gags pa dang / skyes pa'o //
translated: degeneration of the faculties, the object not appearing, no mental activity, not obtaining, incompatibility, abandonment, cessation, and arising.

original: de las bzlog pa ni skye bar blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni skye bar blta bar bya ste /
translated: The opposite of that should be seen as arising.

original: rgyu 'di dag kho nas 'gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: rgyu 'di dag kho nas 'gyur bar zad do //
translated: It is only due to these causes that there is change.

original: de la skye ba'i rgyu rnams kyi sems skye ba gang yin pa de ni /üîΩsems yod pa'i sa'o //üîΩmi skye ba'i rgyu rnams kyis /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rgyu rnams kyi sems skye ba gang yin pa de ni / sems yod pa'i sa'o // mi skye ba'i rgyu rnams kyis /
translated: The state of mind that arises due to the causes of arising is the state of mind that exists.

original: mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni sems med pa'i sa'o //üîΩde la gnas skabs rnam par gzhag pa ni /üîΩgnas skabs drug ma gtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba gang yin pa de ni sems med pa'i sa'o // de la gnas skabs rnam par gzhag pa ni / gnas skabs drug ma gtogs pa ste /
translated: The state of mind that does not arise due to the causes of non-arising is the state of mind that does not exist.

original: sems yod pa'i sa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems yod pa'i sa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The state of mind that exists is established as the six states of mind that exist.üîΩThe state of mind that does not exist is established as the six states of mind that do not exist.

original: gnas skabs drug po gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs drug po gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the six states of mind that exist?

original: gnyid sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / brgyal ba sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: gnyid sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / brgyal ba sems med pa'i gnas skabs dang / 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / 'du shes med pa pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te /
translated: They are the state of mind that exists in the dream state, the state of mind that exists in the fainting state, the state of mind that exists in the meditative absorption of non-perception, the state of mind that exists in the meditative absorption of cessation, and the state of mind that exists in the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.üîΩThese six states are the states of mind that exist.

original: gnas skabs drug po gang yin pa 'di dag ni sems med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs drug po gang yin pa 'di dag ni sems med pa'i sa'o //
translated: What are the six states of mind that do not exist?

original: de la don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te /
analyzed: de la don dam pa rnam par gzhag pa ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings te /
translated: The ultimate stage is the realm of nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.

original: sems med pa'i sa'o //
analyzed: sems med pa'i sa'o //
translated: It is the stage of no mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩde kun gzhi rnam par @161a * //
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / de kun gzhi rnam par @161a * //
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because the foundation consciousnessüîΩceases there.

original: des na sems med pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na sems med pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the stage of no mind.

original: de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gag la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i gnas skabs dag ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gag la /
translated: In other circumstances, the active forms of consciousness cease,

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni 'gag par mi 'gyur te /
translated: but the foundation consciousness does not cease.

original: des na don dam pa'i sgo nas sems med pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na don dam pa'i sgo nas sems med pa'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, from the ultimate point of view, it is called the stage of no mind.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las sems yod pa'i sa dang / sems med pa'i sa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa las sems yod pa'i sa dang / sems med pa'i sa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the discussion of the stage of mind and the stage of no mind in the Bodhisattvabhumi.

original: // / thob pa las byung ba'i sa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / thob pa las byung ba'i sa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stage that is attained?

original: de yang mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: rigs pa'i gnas lnga gang yin pa de dag ming dang tshig dang // yi ge las blo sngon du btang ste /
analyzed: rigs pa'i gnas lnga gang yin pa de dag ming dang tshig dang // yi ge las blo sngon du btang ste /
translated: it is the five sciences. They are preceded by the mind that is directed toward names, phrases, and letters.

original: nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / kha ton byed pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs la brten pa'i don rtogs pa 'di ni thos pa las byung ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan pa dang / 'dzin pa dang / 'chang ba dang / kha ton byed pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / yi ge'i tshogs la brten pa'i don rtogs pa 'di ni thos pa las byung ba'i sa zhes bya'o //
translated: The stage that comes from listening is the understanding of the meaning that is based on the collections of names, the collections of phrases, and the collections of letters, and the understanding that comes from memorizing, holding, reciting, and recollecting them.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five branches of learning?

original: 'di lta ste nang gi rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas kyi rig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nang gi rig pa dang / gso ba rig pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi rig pa dang / sgra'i rig pa dang / bzo'i las kyi gnas kyi rig pa'o //
translated: They are the inner science, the science of logic, the science of grammar, the science of the ways of the world, and the science of the crafts and occupations.

original: nang gi rig pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nang gi rig pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the inner science?

original: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa bzhir blta bar bya ste /
translated: It should be regarded as having four aspects:

original: gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bstan pa'i don bsdu ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas so //
analyzed: gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / bstan pa'i don bsdu ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas so //
translated: the presentation of the designation of the bases, the presentation of the designation of the classification of names, the summary of the meaning of the teachings, and the basis of the Buddha's words.

original: de la gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzhi gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the designation of the bases?

original: gzhi gsum gyis sangs rgyas kyi bka' bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhi gsum gyis sangs rgyas kyi bka' bsdus pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha's word is summarized in three bases.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the three?

original: mdo sde'i gzhi dang / 'dul ba'i gzhi dang / ma mo'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: mdo sde'i gzhi dang / 'dul ba'i gzhi dang / ma mo'i gzhi ste /
translated: The Sutra Pitaka, the Vinaya Pitaka, and the MƒÅt·πõkƒÅ Pitaka.

original: gsum po 'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa ni gzhi bsdu ba las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag gi rnam par dbye ba rgyas pa ni gzhi bsdu ba las 'byung ngo //
translated: The detailed classification of these three is found in the Abhidharma.

original: ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ming rab tu dbye ba gdags pa rnam par gzhag pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the presentation of the analysis of names?üîΩThe summary is: Basis, error, proliferation,üîΩAbiding, reality, virtue, supreme,üîΩComplete peace, nature, reasoning,

original: sdom la / gnas dang 'khrul dang spros ba dang // gnas pa de nyid dge dang mchog / rab zhi rang bzhin rigs pa dang // brda dang mngon par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdom la / gnas dang 'khrul dang spros ba dang // gnas pa de nyid dge dang mchog / rab zhi rang bzhin rigs pa dang // brda dang mngon par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Convention, and clear realization.

original: gnas gang zhe na /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is the basis?

original: skye mched drug po /
analyzed: skye mched drug po /
translated: It is the six sense bases,

original: yul tshad med pa /
analyzed: yul tshad med pa /
translated: the immeasurable objects,

original: phyogs tshad med pa /üîΩdus tshad med pa dang / khams gsum ste /
analyzed: phyogs tshad med pa / dus tshad med pa dang / khams gsum ste /
translated: the immeasurable directions,üîΩand the immeasurable times, as well as the three realms.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs @161b kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / gzhan yang khams gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs @161b kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dang / gzhan yang khams gsum ste /
translated: The desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: stong chung ngu dang / stong gnyis pa bar ma dang / stong gsum gyi stong chen po dang / phyogs bzhi ste /

analyzed: ston pa po dang nyan pa po rnams kyi gdams ngag bstan pa la mi mthun pa'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two things that are not to be done in the teaching of advice by the teacher and listening to it by the student:

original: nyan ba pos kyang tshig mi bzod la /
analyzed: nyan ba pos kyang tshig mi bzod la /
translated: the student does not tolerate the words,

original: ston pa po yang phyin ci log tu lta zhing log par zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa po yang phyin ci log tu lta zhing log par zhugs pa'o //
translated: and the teacher has a distorted view and is wrongly oriented.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyang chos gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyang chos gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: The two things that are to be done should be understood as the opposite of those.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i legs pa'i tshul yang dag par spyod pa'i mtshams las 'das par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i legs pa'i tshul yang dag par spyod pa'i mtshams las 'das par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two things that are not to be done in the practice of the right way of good conduct, whether mundane or supramundane:

original: bdag nyid kyi chos kyi dbang las byung ba'i sgo nas 'bras bu mi sdug pa la mi lta bas kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dzem pa dang / gzhan gyis bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / sma dbab pa dang / smad pa la mi lta bas tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dzem pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi chos kyi dbang las byung ba'i sgo nas 'bras bu mi sdug pa la mi lta bas kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dzem pa dang / gzhan gyis bsad pa dang / bcing ba dang / sma dbab pa dang / smad pa la mi lta bas tshe 'di'i kha na ma tho ba la mi 'dzem pa'o //
translated: One does not avoid the offense of not looking at an unpleasant result that arises from one‚Äôs own unwholesome dharmas. One does not avoid the offense of this life that arises from not looking at the killing, binding, humbling, and reproaching of others.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos kyang gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos kyang gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the opposite of these two unwholesome dharmas is the two wholesome dharmas.

original: tshegs med pa dang 'bras bu yod par tshangs par spyod cing gnas par 'gyur ba ni bcas pa gnyis te /üîΩyang dag par bslab pa'i gzhi bcas gang las 'gal bar byas nas /
analyzed: tshegs med pa dang 'bras bu yod par tshangs par spyod cing gnas par 'gyur ba ni bcas pa gnyis te / yang dag par bslab pa'i gzhi bcas gang las 'gal bar byas nas /
translated: There are two rules that one should know, because one can practice celibacy without difficulty and with a good result.üîΩThe first rule is that which is transgressed and gives rise to a great offense.

original: kha na ma tho ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gal ba byas nas slar yang dag par nges par 'byung bar bcas pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gal ba byas nas slar yang dag par nges par 'byung bar bcas pa'o //
translated: The second rule is that which is transgressed and then corrected.

original: bya ba byas pa rnams kyi bdag dang pha rol la phan par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: bya ba byas pa rnams kyi bdag dang pha rol la phan par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two dharmas that benefit oneself and others when one has done what should be done.

original: dben pa na gnas shing sems mnyam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: dben pa na gnas shing sems mnyam par gzhag pa /
translated: He dwells in solitude and his mind is concentrated.

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang / 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas na yang /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang / 'du 'dzi'i nang na gnas na yang /
translated: Even when he dwells in the midst of the crowd,

original: rigs kyi bu chos 'dod pa rnams la dus dus su dam pa'i chos ston cing dam pa'i chos la rtog pa'o //üîΩso so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / pha rol gyi @167a * //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu chos 'dod pa rnams la dus dus su dam pa'i chos ston cing dam pa'i chos la rtog pa'o // so so rang gi tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / pha rol gyi @167a * //
translated: he teaches the true Dharma to those who desire it, and he reflects on the true Dharma.

original: sgra'i rgyu las byung bas /
analyzed: sgra'i rgyu las byung bas /
translated: The Dharma that is the cause of the proper mental attention of each individual, and the Dharma that is the cause of the sound of another.

original: tshe 'di la bden pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bden pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two Dharmas that lead to the realization of the truth in this life:

original: phyi ma la dbang po yongs su smin par byas pa'i phyir //
analyzed: phyi ma la dbang po yongs su smin par byas pa'i phyir //
translated: The Dharma that is the cause of the ripening of the faculties in the next life,üîΩand the Dharma that is the cause of the realization of the truth in this very life.

original: rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rgyu so sor rtog pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo zab par snang ba stong pa nyid dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: rgyu las byung ba'i chos rnams kyi yang dag pa'i rgyu so sor rtog pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde zab mo zab par snang ba stong pa nyid dang ldan zhing /
translated: The correct discernment of the true cause of the dharmas that arise from causes, and the profound sutras spoken by the Tathagata, which are profound and appear to be empty,

original: rkyen 'di'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / mthun pa rnam par rgyun du yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen 'di'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / mthun pa rnam par rgyun du yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the practice of the bodhisattva who is in the stage of action in faith, who has not yet attained the stages, who is not free from the danger of falling into the other vehicles, who has not yet attained the tolerance of the noncreation of things.

original: gang zag dbang po yongs su smin pa'i mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang zag dbang po yongs su smin pa'i mngon par shes pa myur bar 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma which is conducive to the quick attainment of the superknowledges by the person whose faculties are mature is twofold:

original: gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gdams ngag rjes su bstan pa ni /
translated: The instruction and teaching are

original: sgyu dang g-yo med pa dang / skyo ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang / ngag dang yid rgod pa med pa spyod pa'o //üîΩtshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig tu 'khod pa nas /
analyzed: sgyu dang g-yo med pa dang / skyo ba sngon du 'gro ba'i lus dang / ngag dang yid rgod pa med pa spyod pa'o // tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig tu 'khod pa nas /
translated: the practice of body, speech, and mind which is free from deceit and hypocrisy, and which is preceded by disenchantment.

original: gcig la gcig 'grogs na bde bar 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig 'grogs na bde bar 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma which is conducive to living happily with one‚Äôs companions in the celibate life is twofold:

original: gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa bzod pa dang / bdag nyid kyang gzhan la gnod par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnod par byas pa bzod pa dang / bdag nyid kyang gzhan la gnod par mi byed pa'o //
translated: the tolerance of harm done by others, and the avoidance of doing harm to others.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig tu 'khod pa na /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig tu 'khod pa na /
translated: The Dharma which is conducive to living happily with one‚Äôs companions in the celibate life is twofold:

original: rtsod pa ma byung pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang byung ba rnams zhi bar bya ba dang / 'thab pa med pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba med pa dang / 'gyed pa med pa dang / rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rtsod pa ma byung pa rnams 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba dang byung ba rnams zhi bar bya ba dang / 'thab pa med pa dang / mtshang 'bru ba med pa dang / 'gyed pa med pa dang / rtsod pa med par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma that causes disputes not yet arisen to not arise and those that have arisen to be pacified, and that causes one to be without strife, without fault-finding, without contention, and without dispute, is twofold.

original: gcig la gcig byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / chos dang zang zing thun mong du longs spyod cing gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig byams pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / chos dang zang zing thun mong du longs spyod cing gnas pa'o //
translated: It is to have a mind full of love for one another and to enjoy and abide in the Dharma and material things in common.

original: myur ba myur bar sems gnas par 'gyur ba dang / ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa yongs su dag par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos 'di ni gnyis te /
analyzed: myur ba myur bar sems gnas par 'gyur ba dang / ting nge 'dzin thob par 'gyur ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa yongs su dag par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos 'di ni gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma that causes the mind to quickly become stable, that causes one to attain concentration, and that causes one to abide in pure celibacy is twofold.

original: sngon byas pa dang / sngon smras pa rnams dran pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sngon byas pa dang / sngon smras pa rnams dran pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: It is to remember what was done before and what was said before.

original: nyes pa'i gnyen po chos bzhin du byed cing /
analyzed: nyes pa'i gnyen po chos bzhin du byed cing /
translated: It is to apply the antidotes to faults in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nyes pa med pa la yang dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba de nyid kyi rjes su slob cing nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' thams cad so so yang dag par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: nyes pa med pa la yang dga' ba dang / mchog tu dga' ba de nyid kyi rjes su slob cing nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtha' thams cad so so yang dag par rtog pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: and to take delight in and rejoice in the absence of faults, and to spend day and night following after that delight and rejoicing, and to do so in a way that is governed by the correct understanding of all the activities of body, speech, and mind.

original: nyes pa mi byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa mi byed de /
translated: and in the absence of faults, he delights in them and is supremely delighted. He spends his days and nights following that very delight, and he does not commit any faults, since all his actions of body, speech, and mind are governed by correct understanding.

original: rgyu des 'gyod pa med cing /
analyzed: rgyu des 'gyod pa med cing /
translated: Because of that, he has no regrets.

original: mchog tu @167b dga' la /
analyzed: mchog tu @167b dga' la /
translated: He is supremely delighted.

original: dga' ba nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i bar du rgyas par sbyar ba'o //üîΩsdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dga' ba nas rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i bar du rgyas par sbyar ba'o // sdug bsngal thams cad las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The text is to be expanded in this way up to ‚Äúhe is liberated through the wisdom of insight.‚ÄùüîΩThere are two teachings that lead to the complete transcendence of all suffering:

original: ngan song gi sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: ngan song gi sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'da' bar 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: the transcendence of the suffering of the unfortunate realms and the transcendence of the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i nyes dmigs mthong nas nyes par spyod pa spong ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams goms par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i nyes dmigs mthong nas nyes par spyod pa spong ba dang / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams goms par byed pa'o //
translated: Having seen the faults of this life and the next, one abandons evil conduct, and by means of a concentrated mind, one cultivates the factors of enlightenment.

original: spong ba pa rab tu dben pa na gnas pa /
analyzed: spong ba pa rab tu dben pa na gnas pa /
translated: The renunciant, dwelling in solitude,

original: bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /üîΩyul la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa las byung ba /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te / yul la kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa las byung ba /
translated: has two qualities that lead to a pleasant abiding.

original: rtog pa ngan pas sems ma dkrugs pa dang / kha zas phan pa dang / dran pa dang / zhu ba'i 'og tu za zhing spong ba dang mthun par lus las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: rtog pa ngan pas sems ma dkrugs pa dang / kha zas phan pa dang / dran pa dang / zhu ba'i 'og tu za zhing spong ba dang mthun par lus las su rung ba'o //
translated: One is not disturbed by evil thoughts, and one has a serviceable body that is suitable for the practice of renunciation, having eaten food that is beneficial, with mindfulness and discernment.

original: dge slong dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa'i dus 'da' bar byed pa 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dge slong dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa'i dus 'da' bar byed pa 'bras bu yod par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The monk who is diligent in virtue has two qualities that lead to a fruitful passing of time.

original: dbang po'i yul du gtogs pa la /
analyzed: dbang po'i yul du gtogs pa la /
translated: One is not attached to the objects of the senses, and one is not attached to sleep.

original: yang dag pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brtson pa dang / dus su ran par gnyid log par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa la brtson pa dang / dus su ran par gnyid log par byed pa'o //
translated: and to strive to discern the true Dharma, and to sleep at the proper time and in moderation.

original: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa nyams par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two things that cause the training in superior mind and the training in superior wisdom to decline:

original: log pa'i bslab pa 'cha' zhing /
analyzed: log pa'i bslab pa 'cha' zhing /
translated: to establish false training and

original: yang dag pa'i bslab pa las 'gal bar byed pa dang / yid gnyis dang yang bcas la /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i bslab pa las 'gal bar byed pa dang / yid gnyis dang yang bcas la /
translated: to violate the true training, and to be uncertain,

original: sgro btags pa dang / skur pa'i log par lta ba la yang nges pa'o //
analyzed: sgro btags pa dang / skur pa'i log par lta ba la yang nges pa'o //
translated: and to be certain about the false views of exaggeration and deprecation.

original: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos kyang gnyis su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i dkar po'i phyogs kyi chos kyang gnyis su rig par bya'o //
translated: The two things that are the opposite of those should be understood as the bright side.

original: gang zag tshogs ni bsags la mngon par rtogs pa ni med pa'i bden pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gang zag tshogs ni bsags la mngon par rtogs pa ni med pa'i bden pa mngon par rtogs par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two things that cause one to realize the truth without realizing the full potential of one‚Äôs spiritual training:

original: bdag dang pha rol gyi da ltar dang 'das pa'i rgud pa dang / 'byor pa yid la byed pa dang / rnam par rtog pas bden pa yang dag par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag dang pha rol gyi da ltar dang 'das pa'i rgud pa dang / 'byor pa yid la byed pa dang / rnam par rtog pas bden pa yang dag par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The attention to the truth is the attention to the present and past misfortune of oneself and others, and the attention to the present and past good fortune of oneself and others.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa shin tu mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'i chos ni @168a * //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi shin tu mthar thug pa dang / shin tu dri ma med pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa shin tu mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'i chos ni @168a * //
translated: The Dharma which is the ultimate perfection, the ultimate purity, and the ultimate accomplishment of the holy life for the yogis is twofold:

original: gnyis te / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / gong du yang 'dod chags dang bral ba la brtson zhing snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi ro myang ba'i gnas ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis te / bden pa mngon par rtogs pa dang / gong du yang 'dod chags dang bral ba la brtson zhing snyoms par 'jug pa thams cad kyi ro myang ba'i gnas ma yin pa'o //
translated: the realization of the truth and the detachment from the higher realms, and the non-enjoyment of all meditative absorptions.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad mngon par bsgrub par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma which is the accomplishment of all mundane and supramundane qualities for the yogis is twofold:

original: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhi drug ste /üîΩ'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa'i chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhi drug ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: The nine states of mental stability and the six topics for discerning the qualities of one's mind when it is in equipoise.

original: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sa las 'byung ngo //
translated: These are discussed in the Sravaka Levels.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of purity for yogins and yoginis:

original: yid la byed pa rnam par dag pa dang / rten rnam par dag pa ste /üîΩyid la byed pa rnam par dag pa ni /
analyzed: yid la byed pa rnam par dag pa dang / rten rnam par dag pa ste / yid la byed pa rnam par dag pa ni /
translated: purity of attention and purity of the physical basis.

original: dus gsum gyi gti mug dang bral bas ye shes rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi gti mug dang bral bas ye shes rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Purity of attention is the purity of transcendent wisdom, which is free of the delusion of the three times.

original: rten rnam par dag pa ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rten rnam par dag pa ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len dang bral ba'o //
translated: Purity of the physical basis is freedom from the negative tendencies that are the afflictions of the three realms.

original: dgra bcom pa sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'i so so rang gis rig par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa sems shin tu rnam par grol ba'i so so rang gis rig par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gnyis te /
translated: There are two qualities that are directly realized by arhats whose minds are completely liberated:

original: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zad pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba phyi ma la sdug bsngal gtan mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la sdug bsngal gyi rgyu zad pa dang / de sngon du 'gro ba phyi ma la sdug bsngal gtan mi skye ba'o //
translated: the exhaustion of the causes of suffering in this life and the complete prevention of suffering in future lives.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas gnyis gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas gnyis gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: The second chapter on the two topics of knowledge in the Buddha's word is completed.

original: // / sems can rnams la sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni rnam pa bcu dang / sgo gsum dang / rnam pa gsum dang / rtsa ba gsum mo //
analyzed: // / sems can rnams la sems can rnams kyi log par bsgrub pa ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni rnam pa bcu dang / sgo gsum dang / rnam pa gsum dang / rtsa ba gsum mo //
translated: The ten kinds of perversions of sentient beings, which lead to bad rebirths, are the three doors, the three kinds, and the three roots.

original: de la rnam pa bcu po ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bcu po ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The ten kinds are as follows:

original: srog dang / longs spyod pa dang / chung ma ma rung bar byed pa dang / bden pa'i don dang / mdza' bo dang / bsngags pa dang / bya ba ma rung bar byed pa dang / yid kyi rnyog pa rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: srog dang / longs spyod pa dang / chung ma ma rung bar byed pa dang / bden pa'i don dang / mdza' bo dang / bsngags pa dang / bya ba ma rung bar byed pa dang / yid kyi rnyog pa rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: perverting life, wealth, and wife; perverting the meaning of truth; perverting friends, praise, and deeds; and the three kinds of mental defilements.üîΩThe three doors are:

original: gzhan gyi longs spyod pa bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol mi 'dod pa dang / phrad par 'dod pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ngan pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi longs spyod pa bdag gir bya bar 'dod pa dang / pha rol mi 'dod pa dang / phrad par 'dod pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba ngan pa'o //
translated: desiring to make others' wealth one's own, not desiring others' wealth, and desiring to meet with praise.

original: de la sgo gsum ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la sgo gsum ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: The three kinds are:

original: bya ba ma rung bar byed pa dang / bsam pa ma rung bar byed pa dang / sbyor ba ma rung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba ma rung bar byed pa dang / bsam pa ma rung bar byed pa dang / sbyor ba ma rung bar byed pa ste /
translated: 1. making the action improper, 2. making the intention improper, 3. making the application improper.

original: rnam pa bcu po de dag nyid las bdun ni bya ba ma @168b rung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de dag nyid las bdun ni bya ba ma @168b rung bar byed pa'o //
translated: From among these ten aspects, seven make the action improper.

original: gnyis ni bsam pa ma rung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis ni bsam pa ma rung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Two make the intention improper.

original: tha ma ste /
analyzed: tha ma ste /
translated: The last one,

original: lta ba ngan pa gcig ni sbyor ba ma rung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba ngan pa gcig ni sbyor ba ma rung bar byed pa ste /

original: 'di ltar lta ba ngan pa las ni sdig pa kun du spyod par mi 'gyur ba'i ngo tsha shes pa gang yin pa dang / snying rje gang yin pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar lta ba ngan pa las ni sdig pa kun du spyod par mi 'gyur ba'i ngo tsha shes pa gang yin pa dang / snying rje gang yin pa de 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, from a bad view, there is no shame in the performance of evil, and there is no compassion.

original: de ngo tsha mi shes shing /
analyzed: de ngo tsha mi shes shing /
translated: Because of that shamelessness and

original: snying rje med pas sdig pa la sbyor ro //
analyzed: snying rje med pas sdig pa la sbyor ro //
translated: lack of compassion, one applies oneself to evil.

original: de la rnam pa gsum ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa gsum ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: Therein, there are three aspects:

original: lus kyi dang / ngag gi dang / sems las byung ba'i 'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dang / ngag gi dang / sems las byung ba'i 'o //
translated: bodily, verbal, and mental.

original: de la rtsa ba gsum ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba gsum ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: Therein, there are three roots:

original: bdag la phan par bya ba'i rgyu dang / gzhan dag la gnod par bya ba'i rgyu dang / pha rol la phyin ci log pa ste /
analyzed: bdag la phan par bya ba'i rgyu dang / gzhan dag la gnod par bya ba'i rgyu dang / pha rol la phyin ci log pa ste /
translated: the cause of benefiting oneself, the cause of harming others, and the cause of error with regard to others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /

analyzed: chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa la bya bar 'du shes pa lhag par spyod pa'o //
translated: They are the practice of the notion that what is not Dharma is Dharma and the practice of the notion that what is not action is action.

original: dbang po ma bsdams par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang po ma bsdams par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three things that cause the faculties to be unguarded:

analyzed: log pa'i sa bon rten la yod pa dang / mtshan ma ngan pa 'dzin pa yul la yod pa dang / lkog na rtog pa ngan pa'o //
translated: the presence of the seed of error in the self, the presence of the sign of evil in the object, and the presence of evil imagination in secret.

original: rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po de dag kyang 'dod pa la 'dod chags dang / gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These three kinds should be understood as the side of passion, malice, and violence.

original: rtog pa ngan pa gsum ni /
analyzed: rtog pa ngan pa gsum ni /
translated: There are three kinds of evil imagination:

original: gnas bzhi la brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas bzhi la brten nas 'byung bar 'gyur te /

original: bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi chos dkar po'i phyogs rnyed pa la sogs pa bzhi po rnams 'thob pa'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi 'jig rten gyi chos dkar po'i phyogs rnyed pa la sogs pa bzhi po rnams 'thob pa'am /
translated: the four worldly things that are the side of virtue, such as gain, etc.,

original: chud mi za ba la brten nas /üîΩ'dod pa la rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chud mi za ba la brten nas / 'dod pa la rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The conception of desire arises in dependence on the non-abandonment of desire.

original: mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la brten nas /
analyzed: mi mdza' ba dang / tha mal pa'i phyogs la brten nas /
translated: The conception of ill-will arises in dependence on the side of those who are not dear and those who are neutral,

original: 'di ni mchog tu bgegs byed pa yin no snyam ste /üîΩgnod sems kyi rtog pa 'byung ngo //üîΩmdza' bo'i phyogs la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ni mchog tu bgegs byed pa yin no snyam ste / gnod sems kyi rtog pa 'byung ngo // mdza' bo'i phyogs la brten nas /
translated: thinking that they are the greatest obstacles.üîΩThe conception of malice arises in dependence on the side of those who are not dear.

original: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe ba'i rtog pa 'byung ste /
translated: The conception of violence arises in dependence on the side of those who are dear,

original: 'di ltar skye bo dag ni mdza' bo'i phyogs las brgya la nyes pa zhig byung na /
analyzed: 'di ltar skye bo dag ni mdza' bo'i phyogs las brgya la nyes pa zhig byung na /
translated: because when someone on the side of those who are dear commits an offense,

original: skye po la thams cad kyi thams cad du phung bar bya bar 'dod pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: skye po la thams cad kyi thams cad du phung bar bya bar 'dod pa mi skye ste /
translated: people do not wish to destroy him completely and in every way,

original: gnod pa'i sbyor ba chung ngus gnod par bya bar 'dod pa tsam nyi tsher zad do //
analyzed: gnod pa'i sbyor ba chung ngus gnod par bya bar 'dod pa tsam nyi tsher zad do //
translated: but only wish to harm him a little, with a small application of violence.

original: de las bzlog pa dkar po'i phyogs kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dkar po'i phyogs kyang de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The side of virtue should be understood in the same way, according to the circumstances.

original: sa bon thams cad ni mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: sa bon thams cad ni mdor bsdu na /
translated: All seeds are included in four seeds:üîΩthe seed of the realm of desire,

original: sa bon @169a * //üîΩbzhir 'dus te /
analyzed: sa bon @169a * //üîΩbzhir 'dus te /
translated: the seed of the realm of form,üîΩthe seed of the formless realm, and the seed of disconnection.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / ma dag pa'i sa bon dang / dag pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / ma dag pa'i sa bon dang / dag pa'i sa bon no //
translated: mundane, supramundane, impure seeds, and pure seeds.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi sa bon gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi sa bon gang yin pa'o //
translated: The mundane is that which is the seed of the formations associated with the realms of desire, form, and formlessness.
