translated: The supramundane is that which is the seed of the attainment of the eightfold noble path of the three vehicles together with its result.

original: ma dag pa'i sa bon ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma dag pa'i sa bon ni 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The impure seed should be understood as that of the formations associated with the realm of desire.

original: dag pa'i sa bon ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dag pa'i sa bon ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The pure seed is twofold:

original: 'jig rten pa'i dag pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dag pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i 'o //
translated: mundane purity and supramundane purity.

original: de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i'o //
analyzed: de la gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i 'du byed rnams kyi sa bon gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten pa'i'o //
translated: The seed of the formations associated with the realms of form and formlessness is mundane purity.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa 'bras bu dang bcas par 'thob par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i'o //
translated: The supramundane is that by which one obtains the noble path with its eight factors and its fruit.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni rgyu las 'byung ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rgyu ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni rgyu las 'byung ba'i chos zag pa dang bcas pa rnams kyi rgyu ste /
translated: These three are the causes of the dharmas that arise from causes and are associated with the outflows.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa la brtson pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin la brtson pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su shes nas spong par 'gyur ba ste 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams la nyon mongs pa can gyis don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa la brtson pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / tshul bzhin la brtson pa rnams kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su shes nas spong par 'gyur ba ste 'dod pa dang ldan pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa dang ldan pa'i chos rnams la nyon mongs pa can gyis don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The cause of the arising of suffering for those who are not intent on what is proper, and the cause of the abandonment of suffering through the complete knowledge of its cause for those who are intent on what is proper.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa gsum po 'di dag ni /
translated: These three kinds of mental defilement

original: sems can rnams 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams 'khor ba na 'khor bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: cause sentient beings to revolve in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa dang po ni /
translated: The first kind of mental defilement

original: 'dod pa khyad par can mngon du 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa khyad par can mngon du 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: is that of those who desire the special objects of the senses.

original: gnyis pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su lus kyi khyad par can mngon du 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su lus kyi khyad par can mngon du 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The second is for those who desire to manifest a special body in the form and formless realms.

original: gsum pa ni log pa'i thar pa mngon du 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni log pa'i thar pa mngon du 'dod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The third is for those who desire to manifest a false liberation.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba bdun pa'i gzhi las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba bdun pa'i gzhi las byung ba ste /
translated: These three arise from the basis of the seven types of application of sentient beings' karma.

original: 'dod pa khyad par can thob par bya ba dang / lus khyad par can thob par bya ba @169b dang / thar pa'i lam thob par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa khyad par can thob par bya ba dang / lus khyad par can thob par bya ba @169b dang / thar pa'i lam thob par bya ba'o //
translated: They are: to obtain a special desire realm, to obtain a special body, and to obtain the path of liberation.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni khams gsum du sems can rnams kyi lus 'dzin pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni khams gsum du sems can rnams kyi lus 'dzin pa'i phyir 'du byed rnams kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: These three are the causes of formations that hold the bodies of sentient beings in the three realms.

original: 'phen pa dang / 'thob par byed pa dang / yongs su grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'phen pa dang / 'thob par byed pa dang / yongs su grub pa ste /
translated: They are: propelling, producing, and completing.

original: 'phen pa ni las so //
analyzed: 'phen pa ni las so //
translated: Propelling is karma.

original: 'thob par byed pa ni dri za nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'thob par byed pa ni dri za nye bar gnas pa'o //

original: yongs su grub pa ni gang du gnas na las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni gang du gnas na las dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnams kyi rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba'o //
translated: The perfected is where the maturation of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions is experienced.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa'i phung po ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi ma rig pa'i phung po ste /
translated: These three are the mass of ignorance of sentient beings.

original: gang dag gis ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dus gsum gyi lus las mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang dag gis ma rig pa dang ldan pa rnams kyi dus gsum gyi lus las mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Through them, those who are ignorant manifest bodies in the three times.

original: 'das pa'i dus na sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni /
translated: Ignorance of the past in the present manifests the present body.

original: da ltar byung ba'i lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩda ltar byung ba'i dus na /üîΩsngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o // da ltar byung ba'i dus na / sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i'o //
translated: Ignorance of the future in the present manifests the future body.üîΩIgnorance of the past and future in the present manifests the past and future bodies.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi phyi ma phyi ma'i lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa mi shes pa ni ma 'ongs pa nyid kyi phyi ma phyi ma'i lus mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Ignorance of the past and future in the future manifests the past and future bodies.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i mthar thug par gyur pa ma yin pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i gnod pa dang / so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i mthar thug par gyur pa ma yin pa rnams kyi 'khor ba'i gnod pa dang / so so'i skye bo dang thun mong ba ste /
translated: These three are the harm of cyclic existence for those who have not become ultimate ƒÅryas and are shared with ordinary beings.

original: nad med pa ma rung bar byed pa dang / lang tsho ma rung bar byed pa dang / 'tsho ba ma rung bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nad med pa ma rung bar byed pa dang / lang tsho ma rung bar byed pa dang / 'tsho ba ma rung bar byed pa ste /
translated: They are the harm of sickness, the harm of aging, and the harm of death.

original: de dag ma 'ongs pa na rjes su 'brang bar yang dag par mthong ba'i mkhas pa rnams kyis de dag las myur ba myur bar rgyags pa gsum spangs te /
analyzed: de dag ma 'ongs pa na rjes su 'brang bar yang dag par mthong ba'i mkhas pa rnams kyis de dag las myur ba myur bar rgyags pa gsum spangs te /
translated: The wise, who see that these will follow in the future, quickly abandon the three poisons.

analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa'i phyir brtson par bya'o //

original: gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi 'ching ba'i gnas dang / rten gyi gnas skabs yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi 'ching ba'i gnas dang / rten gyi gnas skabs yin te /
translated: These three are the basis and the occasion for the fetters of attachment, aversion, and delusion of sentient beings.

original: de dag ni sems can 'khor ba'i btson rar bcug pa rnams bcing ba dam pos 'ching bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni sems can 'khor ba'i btson rar bcug pa rnams bcing ba dam pos 'ching bar 'gyur te /
translated: They are the fetters that bind sentient beings who are imprisoned in the prison of cyclic existence with strong bonds.

original: phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang / mnyam pa de gnyi ga med pa'o /üîΩ// / bam po bcu drug pa /üîΩsems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ni /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa dang / gnod par byed pa dang / mnyam pa de gnyi ga med pa'o / // / bam po bcu drug pa / sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal ni /
translated: 1. the beneficial, 2. the harmful, and 3. the neither beneficial nor harmful.

original: sdug bsngal gyi gnas gsum gyis bsdus pa yin te /üîΩphrad pa @170a * //üîΩlas de dag byung ba dang / bral ba las byung ba dang / rtag tu yod pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi gnas gsum gyis bsdus pa yin te / phrad pa @170a * // las de dag byung ba dang / bral ba las byung ba dang / rtag tu yod pa'o //
translated: The suffering of sentient beings is included in three types of suffering.

original: de la dang po ni gnod par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs dang phrad pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni gnod par 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs dang phrad pa'o //
translated: The three types of suffering are: 1. the suffering of suffering, 2. the suffering of change, and 3. the suffering of the formative forces.üîΩThe suffering of suffering is the suffering that is obvious to everyone, such as the suffering that arises from contact with an object that is extremely painful.

original: gnyis pa ni phan 'dogs pa las yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni phan 'dogs pa las yongs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering that arises from a change in the beneficial.

original: gsum pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du gnas pa'i gnas ngan len gyis bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnas skabs thams cad du gnas pa'i gnas ngan len gyis bsdus pa ste /
translated: The suffering of the formative forces is the suffering that is included in the negative reflex actions that exist in all situations.

original: 'du byed rnams ni de lta bu'i tshul du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni de lta bu'i tshul du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the formative forces arise in this manner.

original: de la ni 'phags pa rnams kho na sdug bsngal gyi blo 'byung gi / so so'i skye bo rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni 'phags pa rnams kho na sdug bsngal gyi blo 'byung gi / so so'i skye bo rnams ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The noble ones have the idea of suffering in regard to this, but not ordinary people.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni dge sbyong du byed pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa rnams kyi rgyun du 'jug pa'i yan lag dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni dge sbyong du byed pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson pa rnams kyi rgyun du 'jug pa'i yan lag dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: These three are the branches of entry into the stream for those who strive to attain the state of a sramana.

original: sems khengs shing dge sbyong du byed pa la bar du gcod par 'gyur ba yin gyi thob par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems khengs shing dge sbyong du byed pa la bar du gcod par 'gyur ba yin gyi thob par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not the cause for attaining the state of a sramana, but are the cause for the pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI am a sramana,‚Äù and they are the cause for the pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI am a brahmana.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag dang bdag sgrun cing bdag drag go snyam du sems khengs pa dang / bdag 'dra'o snyam pa dang / bdag dma'o snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag dang bdag sgrun cing bdag drag go snyam du sems khengs pa dang / bdag 'dra'o snyam pa dang / bdag dma'o snyam du sems khengs pa'o //
translated: They are the cause for the pride of thinking, ‚ÄúI am superior,‚Äù ‚ÄúI am equal,‚Äù and ‚ÄúI am inferior.‚Äù

original: 'du byed thams cad 'jug pa la ni sa bon gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad 'jug pa la ni sa bon gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: The entry into all formations should be understood as having three seeds:

original: 'bras bu phyung zin pa dang / 'bras bu ma phyung ba dang / 'bras bu nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu phyung zin pa dang / 'bras bu ma phyung ba dang / 'bras bu nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: the seed that has already produced a result, the seed that has not yet produced a result, and the seed that is presently producing a result.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams kyi tha snyad kyi gzhi ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni 'du byed rnams kyi tha snyad kyi gzhi ste /
translated: These three are the bases of the conventional expressions of formations:

original: byung zin pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi'o //
analyzed: byung zin pa dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi'o //
translated: that which has already arisen, that which will arise, and that which is presently arising.

original: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid thams cad ni mtshan nyid gsum du 'dus te /
analyzed: gzugs kyi mtshan nyid thams cad ni mtshan nyid gsum du 'dus te /
translated: All the characteristics of form are included in three characteristics:

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / byed par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / byed par gnas pa'o //
translated: color, shape, and arrangement.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas bzung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i gzugs de dag gi phyogs su 'gro ba dang / gnas la sgrib par gnas pa dbang po'i gzugs dang / yul gyi gzugs thams cad de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas bzung ba dang / de las gzhan pa'i gzugs de dag gi phyogs su 'gro ba dang / gnas la sgrib par gnas pa dbang po'i gzugs dang / yul gyi gzugs thams cad de /
translated: The form of the sense faculties is the form that is the object of visual consciousness and the form that is the object of the other sense faculties, such as the form that is the object of tactile consciousness.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na /
translated: All of these are included in the following ten types of form.

original: gzugs rnam pa bcu yod par rig par bya'o //üîΩmnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i gzugs ni ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa sprul pa sgrub pa la sbyor ba'i gzugs gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs rnam pa bcu yod par rig par bya'o // mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i gzugs ni ting nge 'dzin 'thob pa sprul pa sgrub pa la sbyor ba'i gzugs gang yin pa ste /
translated: It should be understood that there are ten types of form.üîΩThe form of the realm of meditative concentration is the form that is the object of the mind in meditative equipoise.

original: so so rang gi sprul pa'i sems kyi yul du gyur pa sprul pa'i sems yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: so so rang gi sprul pa'i sems kyi yul du gyur pa sprul pa'i sems yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The form of emanation is the form that is the object of the mind that creates emanations.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang / rjes su 'brel pa @170b dang bcas pa'i yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa rnams dang / rjes su 'brel pa @170b dang bcas pa'i yin te /
translated: These three types of form are related to the mental afflictions.

original: so so'i skye bo'i sems dang / slob pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i sems dang / slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sems so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i sems dang / slob pa yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i sems dang / slob pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i sems so //
translated: the mind of the ordinary man, the mind of the disciple who is not yet perfect, and the mind of the disciple who is perfect.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni chos nyan par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni chos nyan par byed pa ste /
translated: There are three kinds of listeners:

original: chos dang don gnyer ba dang / 'dzin par mi nus pa dang / len nus la 'dzin mi nus pa dang / len pa dang 'dzin par yang nus pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang don gnyer ba dang / 'dzin par mi nus pa dang / len nus la 'dzin mi nus pa dang / len pa dang 'dzin par yang nus pa'o //
translated: those who are not able to grasp the teaching and its meaning, those who are able to grasp it but not to retain it, and those who are able to grasp and retain it.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid mi rtag par rtag par bya ba la 'jug pa'i thog mar 'gro ba'i chos ni gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi lus dang ngag dang yid mi rtag par rtag par bya ba la 'jug pa'i thog mar 'gro ba'i chos ni gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The three things which are the basis of the practice of the yogis, the beginning of the practice of making the impermanent body, speech and mind permanent, are:

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba rnams dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dang / 'du shes dang sems pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / 'byung ba rnams dang / rtog pa dang dpyod pa rnams dang / 'du shes dang sems pa'o //
translated: breathing in and out, discursive and nondiscursive thought, and perception and volition.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni khyad par du 'phags pa rim gro bya bar 'os pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni khyad par du 'phags pa rim gro bya bar 'os pa yin te /
translated: There are three kinds of people who are worthy of special honor:

original: na tshod kyis lhag pa dang / rigs kyis lhag pa dang / yon tan gyis ltag pa'o //
analyzed: na tshod kyis lhag pa dang / rigs kyis lhag pa dang / yon tan gyis ltag pa'o //
translated: those who are older in years, those who are of higher caste, and those who have greater virtues.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni nges pa dang ma nges pa la gnas pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni nges pa dang ma nges pa la gnas pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: These three are the causes of the certainty and uncertainty of the life of the teaching.

original: de la gnyis ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnyis ni nges pa'o //
translated: Two of them are certain.

original: gcig ni ma nges pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ni ma nges pa ste /
translated: One is uncertain.

original: ngan song du nges pa ni mtshams med pa'i las so //
analyzed: ngan song du nges pa ni mtshams med pa'i las so //
translated: The certainty of the lower realms is the karma of the five heinous acts.

original: bde 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das par nges pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos zag pa med pa rnams so //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang / mya ngan las 'das par nges pa ni 'dus byas kyi chos zag pa med pa rnams so //
translated: The certainty of the happy realms and nirvana is the conditioned uncontaminated dharmas.

original: de ma yin pa rnams ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa rnams ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: The others are uncertain.

original: bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'gal bar byas pa gcig la gcig brjod par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gsum ste /
analyzed: bstan pa gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'gal bar byas pa gcig la gcig brjod par 'gyur ba'i chos ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three dharmas that are spoken of in order to accuse one another for the sake of maintaining the teaching:

original: bslab pa las 'gal bar byas pa'i lus dang ngag gi spyod pa mngon sum du gyur ba dang / gzhan las thos pa dang / mtshan ma gzhan las rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa las 'gal bar byas pa'i lus dang ngag gi spyod pa mngon sum du gyur ba dang / gzhan las thos pa dang / mtshan ma gzhan las rtogs pa'o //
translated: the manifest physical and verbal conduct that is contrary to the training, what is heard from others, and what is understood from other signs.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi bsrung ba med pa gsum brjod pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid kyi bsrung ba med pa gsum brjod pas ni /
translated: The three fearlessnesses of the Tathagata are spoken of

original: phyi rol gyi ston pa khong na rong du srel ba /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ston pa khong na rong du srel ba /
translated: because the other teachers are like a burning house.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen par khas 'che ba rnams la yang dag par bskul bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa thams cad mkhyen par khas 'che ba rnams la yang dag par bskul bar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the bodhisattva is the one who truly admonishes those who are not omniscient but claim to be omniscient.

original: de dag bdag nyid la yang dag par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par yid ches bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag bdag nyid la yang dag par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yin par yid ches bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For he generates confidence in himself that he is truly omniscient.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni log par mngon par zhen pa las skyes pa me chen po las byung ba sems can rnams yongs su sreg pa ste /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni log par mngon par zhen pa las skyes pa me chen po las byung ba sems can rnams yongs su sreg pa ste /
translated: These three are the great fires that arise from wrong adherence, and they burn sentient beings:

original: sred pa'i yongs su sreg pa dang / mya ngan gyi yongs su sreg pa dang / phyin ci log gi yongs su sreg pa'o//
analyzed: sred pa'i yongs su sreg pa dang / mya ngan gyi yongs su sreg pa dang / phyin ci log gi yongs su sreg pa'o//
translated: the fire of craving, the fire of sorrow, and the fire of error.üîΩThese three are not fire but are called fire because they are the fires of hell, the fires of the gods, and the fires of humans.

original: @171a * // gsum po 'di dag ni bsod nams 'dod nas log par phyi rol gyi me la rim gro bya bar mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi rim gror bya ba don med par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩme ma yin par me'i sgrar brjod pa ste /
analyzed: @171a * // gsum po 'di dag ni bsod nams 'dod nas log par phyi rol gyi me la rim gro bya bar mos pa'i sems can rnams kyi rim gror bya ba don med par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩme ma yin par me'i sgrar brjod pa ste /
translated: These three are not useless for those sentient beings who, desiring merit, are devoted to the external fire of worship, because they are the means for attaining the three kinds of perfect knowledge.

original: pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / yon gnas rnams so //üîΩmngon bar mtho ba 'dod pa rnams kyi /
analyzed: pha ma dang / bu dang / chung ma dang / yon gnas rnams so // mngon bar mtho ba 'dod pa rnams kyi /
translated: parents, children, spouse, and those worthy of gifts.

original: mngon par mthong ba'i lam bstan pa ni gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mngon par mthong ba'i lam bstan pa ni gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: The path of seeing should be understood as threefold for those who desire high status.

original: longs spyod chen po'i phyir ni sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod chen po'i phyir ni sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity is for the sake of great wealth.

original: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ni tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bde 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ni tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is for the sake of going to good rebirths.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / gcig tu nges par bde zhing gnod pa med pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar bya ba'i phyir ni bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir dang / gcig tu nges par bde zhing gnod pa med pa'i 'jig rten du skye bar bya ba'i phyir ni bsgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is for the sake of freedom from the feeling of suffering and for the sake of being born in a world that is only happy and free from harm.

original: 'dod pa gsum gyis ni 'dod pa can thams cad kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang / khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa gsum gyis ni 'dod pa can thams cad kyi chung ngu dang 'bring dang / khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur bar rig par bya ste /
translated: The three desires should be understood as lesser, middling, and greater for all who desire.

original: 'dod pa las skyes pa'i bde ba la brten nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa las skyes pa'i bde ba la brten nas /
translated: Based on the happiness that arises from desire,

original: tshegs che zhing rkyen la rag las pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshegs che zhing rkyen la rag las pa 'di lta ste /
translated: there is great difficulty and dependence on conditions, namely,

original: 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa nye bar gnas pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: for those who are attached to desires.

original: tshegs chung zhing sems la rag las pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshegs chung zhing sems la rag las pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The pleasure of the first meditation is small, because it is associated with investigation and examination.üîΩThe pleasure of the second meditation is middling, because it is associated with joy.

original: 'dod pa sprul pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa sprul pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The pleasure of the third meditation is great, because it is associated with pleasure.üîΩThe pleasure of the fourth meditation is still greater, because it is associated with equanimity which is special.

original: tshes tshegs chung zhing sems la rag las pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshes tshegs chung zhing sems la rag las pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The pleasure of the first meditation is small, because it is associated with investigation and examination.

original: 'dod pa gzhan gyi sprul ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa gzhan gyi sprul ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: The pleasure of the second meditation is middling, because it is associated with joy.üîΩThe pleasure of the third meditation is great, because it is associated with pleasure.üîΩThe pleasure of the fourth meditation is still greater, because it is associated with equanimity which is special.üîΩThe pleasure of the first meditation is small, because it is associated with investigation and examination.üîΩThe pleasure of the second meditation is middling, because it is associated with joy.üîΩThe pleasure of the third meditation is great, because it is associated with pleasure.üîΩThe pleasure of the fourth meditation is still greater, because it is associated with equanimity which is special.üîΩThe pleasure of the first meditation is small, because it is associated with investigation and examination.

original: rnam pa gsum gyi 'dod chags pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i bde ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur par rig par bya ste /üîΩrtog pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rnam pa gsum gyi 'dod chags pa las yang dag par 'das pa'i bde ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / khyad par du 'phags par 'gyur par rig par bya ste / rtog pa dang bcas /
translated: The pleasure of the second meditation is middling, because it is associated with joy.üîΩThe pleasure of the third meditation is great, because it is associated with pleasure.üîΩThe pleasure of the fourth meditation is still greater, because it is associated with equanimity which is special.üîΩThe pleasure of the first meditation is small, because it is associated with investigation and examination.üîΩThe pleasure of the second meditation is middling, because it is associated with joy.üîΩThe pleasure of the third meditation is great, because it is associated with pleasure.üîΩThe pleasure of the fourth meditation is still greater, because it is associated with equanimity which is special.

original: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i dga' ba dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i dga' ba dang // dga' ba med pa'i bde ba'o //
analyzed: dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i dga' ba dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i dga' ba dang // dga' ba med pa'i bde ba'o //
translated: The pleasure of the first meditation is small, because it is associated with investigation and examination.üîΩThe pleasure of the second meditation is middling, because it is associated with joy.

original: shes bya khong du chud pa rnam pa gsum ni theg pa gsum po dag gis sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: shes bya khong du chud pa rnam pa gsum ni theg pa gsum po dag gis sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The pleasure of the third meditation is great, because it is associated with pleasure.üîΩThe pleasure

original: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba dang / so so rang gis dpyad pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sgra'i rgyu las byung ba dang / so so rang gis dpyad pa'i rgyu las byung ba dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la goms pa'i rgyu las byung ba'o //
translated: the cause of which is the speech of another, the cause of which is one‚Äôs own investigation, and the cause of which is the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: gzhan yang shes bya khong du chud pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes bya khong du chud pa gsum yod de /
translated: Moreover, there are three kinds of comprehension of the knowable:

original: 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pa dang / 'ching ba nyams pa dang / 'ching ba thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'o //
analyzed: 'ching ba mtha' dag yod pa dang / 'ching ba nyams pa dang / 'ching ba thams cad kyi thams cad du med pa'o //
translated: that in which all the bonds exist, that in which the bonds are weakened, and that in which all the bonds are completely absent.

original: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bya ba gsum bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum @171b gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa rnams kyi bya ba gsum bya ba'i phyir rnam pa gsum @171b gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: The three kinds of comprehension are taught in terms of the three kinds of practitioners, in order to accomplish the three kinds of tasks of the practitioners.

original: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos bsgom par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos bsgom par rig par bya ste /
translated: The cultivation of the virtues such as faith should be understood in terms of these three kinds of practitioners.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa dang /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu 'thob pa dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pas lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa nyid kyi 'bras bu thob pa dang /
translated: By abandoning the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation, one attains the fruits of once-returner, non-returner, and arhat.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas kyang tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid thob nas kyang tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And having attained the fruit of arhatship, one will abide in bliss in this life.

original: cha gsum gyis shes bya thams cad la lta ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: cha gsum gyis shes bya thams cad la lta ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of the three eyes that see all objects of knowledge,

original: mig gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /üîΩsha'i mig gis ni gzugs snang ba dang / bar du ma chod pa dang / bstan du yod pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: mig gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / sha'i mig gis ni gzugs snang ba dang / bar du ma chod pa dang / bstan du yod pa mthong ngo //
translated: it should be understood that the three eyes are posited.üîΩThe flesh eye sees visible form that is manifest, not obscured, and demonstrable.

original: lha'i mig gis ni gzugs snang ba dang / mi snang ba dang / bar du chod pa dang / ma chod pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: lha'i mig gis ni gzugs snang ba dang / mi snang ba dang / bar du chod pa dang / ma chod pa mthong ngo //
translated: The divine eye sees visible form that is manifest, not manifest, obscured, and not obscured.

original: shes rab kyi mig gis ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mthong ngo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig gis ni gzugs can dang gzugs can ma yin pa'i chos thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mthong ngo //
translated: The eye of wisdom sees all aspects of all things, both those with form and those without form.

original: chos gsum po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa phyir rgol ba kun du 'byung ba 'joms par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: chos gsum po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa phyir rgol ba kun du 'byung ba 'joms par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: These three things destroy the arising of all the afflictions that are the adversaries:

original: gzhan las yid ches pa dang / khyim pa rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang / so so rang gis shes bya'i de kho na rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan las yid ches pa dang / khyim pa rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang / so so rang gis shes bya'i de kho na rtogs pa'o //
translated: confidence in others, living without mixing with householders and renunciates, and realizing the reality of the objects of knowledge by oneself.

original: yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la gong nas gong du rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gsum ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba la gong nas gong du rtogs par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The three kinds of application to right instruction are the means of realizing higher and higher the attainment of nirvana:

original: tshul khrims dang / sems gnas pa dang / shes bya'i de kho na rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / sems gnas pa dang / shes bya'i de kho na rtogs pa'o //
translated: morality, mental stability, and the realization of the reality of the objects of knowledge.

original: yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gsum yod pa bzhin du yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba la goms par bya ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba rnam pa gsum yod pa bzhin du yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba la goms par bya ba yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Just as there are three kinds of application to right instruction, so too should one understand the cultivation of application to right instruction.

original: yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos gsum ste /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su bstan pa'i sbyor ba la gnas pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par 'gyur ba'i chos gsum ste /
translated: There are three dharmas for abiding in the comfort of abiding in the application of right instruction:

original: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams dang / bsam gtan bzhi dang / tshad med pa bzhi'o //
translated: emptiness, wishlessness, signlessness, the meditative absorption of cessation, the four meditative stabilizations, and the four immeasurables.

original: mdor bsdu na /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na /
translated: In brief,

original: sems rtse gcig pa rnam pa gsum ni /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa rnam pa gsum ni /
translated: there are three kinds of one-pointedness of mind:

original: yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong bar 'gyur @172a * //
analyzed: yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong bar 'gyur @172a * //
translated: one will see the wisdom that is right and just as it is.

original: ba ste / yid la brjod pa'i tshe dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa dang / yid la brjod pa'i mjug thogs su dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa dang / yid la brjod pa 'das pa'i 'og tu sems rtse gcig pa dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin zhing tha dad pa ma yin pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: ba ste / yid la brjod pa'i tshe dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa dang / yid la brjod pa'i mjug thogs su dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs tha dad pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa dang / yid la brjod pa 'das pa'i 'og tu sems rtse gcig pa dmigs pa rnam pa sna tshogs ma yin zhing tha dad pa ma yin pa la spyod pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: After the passing of mental expression, there is the aspect of the mind operating on the single objective support, which is not various and not different.

original: gnas gsum ni skye mched ngan pa la log par che ba'i bdag nyid du mos pa rnams dang / 'dul ba tha mal par gnas pa rnams bzlog par bya ba dang / bstan pa la 'dun par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas gsum ni skye mched ngan pa la log par che ba'i bdag nyid du mos pa rnams dang / 'dul ba tha mal par gnas pa rnams bzlog par bya ba dang / bstan pa la 'dun par byed pa ste /
translated: The three stations are: the station of the low sense-sphere, which is the inclination to the nature of the great reversal; the station of the ordinary person, which is the reversal of the inclination to the nature of the great reversal; and the station of the inclination to the teaching, which is the reversal of the station of the ordinary person.

original: bdag gi mthu yang dag par bstan pa dang / pha rol gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa dang / byed du gzhug pa dang / dam pa'i chos bstan pas yang dag par 'doms shing rjes su ston pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gi mthu yang dag par bstan pa dang / pha rol gyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i spyod pa dang / byed du gzhug pa dang / dam pa'i chos bstan pas yang dag par 'doms shing rjes su ston pa'o //
translated: and by demonstrating his own power, by the practice of the purification of the afflictions of others, by causing them to engage in the practice of purification, and by instructing and guiding them with the teaching of the true Dharma.

original: gtsang bar 'dod pas 'bab stegs kyi chus phyi rol gyi dri ma re zhig bsal ba tsam gyis bdag gtsang mar 'dzin pa rnams kyi log pa'i nga rgyal de spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtsang bar 'dod pas 'bab stegs kyi chus phyi rol gyi dri ma re zhig bsal ba tsam gyis bdag gtsang mar 'dzin pa rnams kyi log pa'i nga rgyal de spang ba'i phyir /
translated: Those who consider themselves pure, who think that they are pure because they have removed external impurities with the water of a bathing place, in order to abandon their false pride,

original: yang dag ba'i gtsang ma gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag ba'i gtsang ma gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: the three kinds of true purity should be understood as being set forth.

original: mi gtsang ba'i gnas su skyes pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i gnas su skyes pa las yang dag par 'da' ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause for completely transcending the state of being born in an impure womb.

original: thub pa'i brtul zhugs can dag bsdams pa tsam gyis bdag nyid thub pa yin par log par 'dzin pa rnams /
analyzed: thub pa'i brtul zhugs can dag bsdams pa tsam gyis bdag nyid thub pa yin par log par 'dzin pa rnams /
translated: Those who think that they are sages because they are merely restrained,

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i thub pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i thub pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the nature of the true sage,

original: thub par bya ba gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: thub par bya ba gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that there are three things to be accomplished:üîΩmorality, which is the activity of body and speech included in the morality pleasing to the Subduer;

original: de yang 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / zag pa med pa'i sems so //
analyzed: de yang 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims kyis bsdus pa'i lus dang ngag gi las dang / zag pa med pa'i sems so //
translated: and the uncontaminated mind.

original: chos gsum po 'di dag ni rab tu dben pa na gnas pa'i rtog pa ngan pa kun du 'byung ba spang bar 'gyur te /üîΩpha rol gyis spyad pa dang / bdag nyid smod pa dang / don chen po nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: chos gsum po 'di dag ni rab tu dben pa na gnas pa'i rtog pa ngan pa kun du 'byung ba spang bar 'gyur te / pha rol gyis spyad pa dang / bdag nyid smod pa dang / don chen po nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i dbang du byas te /
translated: These three things are the abandonment of the arising of bad thoughts in one who lives in solitude.

original: khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / gces par 'dzin cing gus par byed pa'o //üîΩlam dang lam gyi 'bras bu las brtsams te /
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / gces par 'dzin cing gus par byed pa'o // lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu las brtsams te /
translated: They are shame, conscience, and respect, which are to be understood as having the significance of the practice of others, of self-reproach, and of the great purpose.

original: dam pa bla na med pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa bla na med pa gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that there are three unsurpassed things, beginning with the path and the result of the path.

original: mi rtag pa dang sdug @172b bsngal shes pa bas bdag med pa shes pa dang lam bzhi las sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang // slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dus kyis rnam par grol ba thams cad las sems rnam par grol ba mi bskyod pa dam pa bla na med pa yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang sdug @172b bsngal shes pa bas bdag med pa shes pa dang lam bzhi las sla la mngon par shes pa myur ba dang / 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa dang // slob pa dang mi slob pa'i dus kyis rnam par grol ba thams cad las sems rnam par grol ba mi bskyod pa dam pa bla na med pa yin te /
translated: The unshakable, supreme, unsurpassed liberation of mind from all mundane and supramundane, learner and nonlearner liberations is the highest.

original: rnal 'byor pas thog ma kho nar ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas thog ma kho nar ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The yogi will first attain wisdom.

original: ye shes kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi nyon mongs pa spong ba bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Wisdom accomplishes the abandonment of afflictions.

original: bsgrubs na sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgrubs na sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When accomplished, the mind is liberated.

original: sngon dang phyi ma dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnams la rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / mthar nyes pa 'dzin cing /
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma dang / dbus kyi mtha' rnams la rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / mthar nyes pa 'dzin cing /
translated: Grasping permanence, annihilation, and faults in the end of the past, future, and middle,

original: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'da' ba la kun du rmongs pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams ma rig pa la gnas par bstan pa'i phyir rig pa gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la mya ngan las 'da' ba la kun du rmongs pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams ma rig pa la gnas par bstan pa'i phyir rig pa gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The three knowledges should be understood as being established in order to show that the ascetics and brahmins who are confused about nirvana in this life are grounded in ignorance.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya gnas gsum gsum pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya gnas gsum gsum pa rdzogs so /
translated: The three topics of the Buddha's word are complete.

original: // / chos bzhi po 'di dag ni shes bya dang / shes par bsdu bar 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: // / chos bzhi po 'di dag ni shes bya dang / shes par bsdu bar 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: These four dharmas are included in the knowable and knowledge.

original: lus dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: lus dang / thos pa dang / bsam pa dang / bsgom pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: In terms of body, hearing, reflection, and meditation,

original: dran pa nye bar gnas pa la brten te /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas pa la brten te /
translated: based on the establishment of mindfulness,

original: lus la dmigs pa'i shes rab bo //
analyzed: lus la dmigs pa'i shes rab bo //
translated: there is the wisdom that observes the body.

original: lus dang lus la dmigs pa'i shes rab ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: lus dang lus la dmigs pa'i shes rab ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the body and the wisdom that observes the body,

original: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dang / de dag la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / sems dang / chos dang / de dag la dmigs pa'i shes rab kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: so too feeling, mind, dharmas, and the wisdom that observes them should be understood.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang sems kyi 'ching ba ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang sems kyi 'ching ba ni bzhi ste /
translated: Furthermore, there are four fetters of the mind.

original: nye bar len pa'i 'ching ba dang / myong ba'i 'ching ba dang / rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba dang / der mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i 'ching ba dang / myong ba'i 'ching ba dang / rnam par rig pa'i 'ching ba dang / der mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching ba'o //
translated: The bonds of appropriation, the bonds of experience, the bonds of representation, and the bonds of attachment.

original: de la nye bar len pa'i 'ching bas ni lus la sems bcings so //
analyzed: de la nye bar len pa'i 'ching bas ni lus la sems bcings so //
translated: Among them, the mind is bound to the body by the bonds of appropriation.

original: nang gi myong ba'i 'ching bas ni tshor ba rnams la bcings so //
analyzed: nang gi myong ba'i 'ching bas ni tshor ba rnams la bcings so //
translated: It is bound to feelings by the bonds of internal experience.

original: rnam par rig pa'i 'ching bas ni gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi mtshan ma rnams la bcings so //üîΩ'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i 'ching bas ni gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi mtshan ma rnams la bcings so // 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: It is bound to the signs of objects such as form, etc. by the bonds of representation.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching bas ji skad du bstan pa'i lus la sogs pa de dag nyid la bcings te /üîΩ'ching ba bzhi po dag gi gnyen po ni dran pa nye @173a * //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i 'ching bas ji skad du bstan pa'i lus la sogs pa de dag nyid la bcings te / 'ching ba bzhi po dag gi gnyen po ni dran pa nye @173a * //
translated: It is bound to those very things such as the body, etc. as they have been taught, by the bonds of attachment, by the afflictions and the secondary afflictions such as desire, etc.

original: bar gzhag pa bzhi yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bar gzhag pa bzhi yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the four foundations of mindfulness are the antidotes to those four bonds.

original: bzhi po 'di ni nyes dmigs la rtog pa dang / gnyen po'i gzhir gyur cing 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba sngon du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di ni nyes dmigs la rtog pa dang / gnyen po'i gzhir gyur cing 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba sngon du 'gro ba ste /
translated: These four are the basis for reflection on the disadvantages, the basis for the antidote, and the basis for aspiration and effort.

original: mi dge ba'i chos kun du spyod par 'gyur pa spang ba'i phyir dang / de dang ldan pa spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / de 'phel par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos kun du spyod par 'gyur pa spang ba'i phyir dang / de dang ldan pa spang ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / de 'phel par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the basis for abandoning the practice of nonvirtuous phenomena, for abandoning the possession of nonvirtue, for obtaining virtuous phenomena, and for increasing virtue.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems gnas par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin 'thob par bya bar brtson pa'i sems gnas par 'byor par 'gyur ba'i skye ba'i sgo yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems gnas par bya ba dang / ting nge 'dzin 'thob par bya bar brtson pa'i sems gnas par 'byor par 'gyur ba'i skye ba'i sgo yin te /
translated: These four are the doors to the arising of the skillfulness that causes the mind to rest and attain concentration.

original: mngon par 'byung bar 'dun pa dang / lung mnod pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / slob pa la brtson pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i sems dang / dben pa na gnas shing chos dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung bar 'dun pa dang / lung mnod pa dang / kha ton bya ba dang / slob pa la brtson pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bzang po'i mtshan ma 'dzin pa'i sems dang / dben pa na gnas shing chos dpyod pa'o //
translated: They are aspiration for renunciation, receiving the scriptures, reciting them, striving in study, the mind that grasps the signs of good concentration, and analyzing the Dharma while living in solitude.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems mnyam par gzhag pa /
translated: These four are the causes of the mind that is well stabilized in equipoise.

original: sems gnas par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems gnas par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The mind becomes stabilized.

original: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas dpyod pa dang bcas /
translated: The mind becomes stabilized with investigation and analysis,

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems gnas pa dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa la dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa dang / btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa'i sems gnas pa dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa med pa la dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa dang / btang snyoms dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / bde ba dang sdug bsngal las yang dag par 'das pa'o //
translated: with joy and bliss, without investigation and analysis, with joy and without joy, with equanimity, with pure mindfulness, and beyond both pleasure and pain.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi de kho na shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi de kho na shes par bya ba ste /
translated: These four are the objects of knowledge of reality that pertain to the factors of defilement and purification.

original: de dag shes na mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag shes na mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they are known, the afflictions that are to be eliminated by the paths of seeing and cultivation are eliminated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyang 'bras bu'i de kho na dang / rgyu'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyang 'bras bu'i de kho na dang / rgyu'i de kho na'o //
translated: The factors of defilement are the reality of result and the reality of cause.

original: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang 'bras bu'i de kho na dang / rgyu'i de kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyang 'bras bu'i de kho na dang / rgyu'i de kho na'o //
translated: The factors of purification are also the reality of result and the reality of cause.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba ste /
translated: These four are the bonds of conceptual elaboration that precede recognition.

original: 'dod pa chung du rnams la 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba dang / gzugs chen por gyur pa rnams la 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba dang / nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched tshad med pa la 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba dang /üîΩci yang med pa'i skye mched la /
analyzed: 'dod pa chung du rnams la 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba dang / gzugs chen por gyur pa rnams la 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba dang / nam mkha' dang rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched tshad med pa la 'du shes sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba dang / ci yang med pa'i skye mched la /
translated: The bonds of conceptual elaboration that precede recognition in those with little desire, the bonds of conceptual elaboration that precede recognition in those with great form, the bonds of conceptual elaboration that precede recognition in the limitless bases of infinite space and infinite consciousness,

original: 'du shes @173b sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes @173b sngon du 'gro ba'i spros pa'i 'ching ba'o //
translated: and the bonds of conceptual elaboration that precede recognition in the base of nothingness.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni /
translated: These four

original: sems can rnams la gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i gnyen por bsgoms na bsod nams chen po 'phel ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la gnod sems dang / rnam par 'tshe ba dang / mi dga' ba dang / 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i gnyen por bsgoms na bsod nams chen po 'phel ba dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: are the antidotes to malice, violence, unhappiness, and desire for sensual objects with regard to sentient beings. If you cultivate them, you will increase your great merit and you will go to a state free from attachment to sensual objects.

original: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: love, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni gzugs kyi khams las 'da' zhing /
analyzed: chos bzhi po 'di dag ni gzugs kyi khams las 'da' zhing /
translated: These four dharmas transcend the form realm

original: ring du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: ring du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: and lead to the far shore.

original: nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rnams so //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ci yang med pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched rnams so //
translated: They are the spheres of infinite space, infinite consciousness, nothing whatsoever, and neither perception nor non-perception.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni rnal 'byor pa rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par bya bar brtson pa'i 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba'i rgyu gang gi rten lta bu'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni rnal 'byor pa rnam par grol ba yongs su rdzogs par bya bar brtson pa'i 'phags pa'i rnam par grol ba'i rgyu gang gi rten lta bu'i chos rnams te /
translated: These four are the dharmas that are like the support for the cause of the noble liberation of the yogi who strives to perfect liberation.

original: sred pa bzhi spang ba'i dbang du byas nas don nyung ba chos gos kyi phyir dang / kha zas kyi phyir dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi phyir rtsol bar mi byed cing g-yeng bar mi byed pa dang / dus su sbyor ba 'bras bu yod par byed cing sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam bsgom pa la dga' ba'o//
analyzed: sred pa bzhi spang ba'i dbang du byas nas don nyung ba chos gos kyi phyir dang / kha zas kyi phyir dang / mal cha dang / stan gyi phyir rtsol bar mi byed cing g-yeng bar mi byed pa dang / dus su sbyor ba 'bras bu yod par byed cing sems rnam par g-yeng ba med pa'i nyon mongs pa spong ba'i lam bsgom pa la dga' ba'o//
translated: In terms of abandoning the four cravings, he is not distracted by striving for the sake of robes, for the sake of food, for the sake of bedding and seats, and he is not distracted by striving for the sake of the present life.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni lam bsgom pa'i 'bras bu nyon mongs pa spong ba yin te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni lam bsgom pa'i 'bras bu nyon mongs pa spong ba yin te /
translated: These four are the results of cultivating the path, which is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spong ba dang / 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa chen po dang / 'bring rnams dang / de dag nyid ma lus par spong ba dang /
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams spong ba dang / 'og ma'i cha dang mthun pa chen po dang / 'bring rnams dang / de dag nyid ma lus par spong ba dang /
translated: They are: abandoning the afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing, abandoning those to be abandoned by the path of meditation, abandoning the great and medium factors associated with the lower realm, and abandoning those very factors without exception.

original: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ma lus par spong ba'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa rnams ma lus par spong ba'o //
translated: And abandoning the factors associated with the higher realm without exception.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi po 'di dag ni /üîΩbstan pa 'di dang / bde 'gro las bsam gtan du mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i yan lag bzhi po 'di dag ni / bstan pa 'di dang / bde 'gro las bsam gtan du mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: These four limbs of stream-entry

original: ston pa de kho na rtog pa las byung ba'i sems dang ba mi g-yo ba dang / ston pa la ji lta ba bzhin du chos dang / chos de gang dag gis rtogs pa dang / de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa rnams la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ston pa de kho na rtog pa las byung ba'i sems dang ba mi g-yo ba dang / ston pa la ji lta ba bzhin du chos dang / chos de gang dag gis rtogs pa dang / de rtogs par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa rnams la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: are the unshakable faith in the teaching, the unshakable faith in the spiritual community, the unshakable faith in the training, and the unshakable faith in the Buddha.üîΩThe unshakable faith in the teaching is the unshakable faith in the four noble truths.üîΩThe unshakable faith in the spiritual community is the unshakable faith in the noble assembly.üîΩThe unshakable faith in the training is the unshakable faith in the eightfold noble path.üîΩThe unshakable faith in the Buddha is the unshakable faith in the Buddha as a teacher.

original: 'di gsum ni sems dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni sems dang po'o //
translated: These three are the first mental state.

original: bzhi pa ni gzugs dang ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gzugs dang ba ste /
translated: The fourth is the unshakable faith in the form realm.

original: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa dgyes pa'i tshul khrims su gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is included in the morality pleasing to the noble ones.

original: @174a * // de la gsum ni bstan pa las mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: @174a * // de la gsum ni bstan pa las mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Among them, the first three are the unshakable faith in the teaching.

original: tha ma gcig ni bde 'gro las mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tha ma gcig ni bde 'gro las mi g-yo bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The last one is the unshakable faith in the happy rebirth.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i yan lag ste /
translated: These four are the limbs for attaining the fruit of stream-entry.

original: ston pa po dang / 'doms pa mgu bar byed pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i chos bstan pa dang / 'doms pa nyan pa dang / de yang dag pa'i bsam pas rtogs par byed pa dang / bsgom pas bsgrub pa'o //üîΩshes pa bzhi po 'di dag ni shes pa thams cad sdud par 'gyur ba ste /üîΩgcig tu nges par zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la mngon sum gyi shes pa dang / lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa dang / gcig tu nges par zag pa dang bcas par rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: ston pa po dang / 'doms pa mgu bar byed pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i chos bstan pa dang / 'doms pa nyan pa dang / de yang dag pa'i bsam pas rtogs par byed pa dang / bsgom pas bsgrub pa'o // shes pa bzhi po 'di dag ni shes pa thams cad sdud par 'gyur ba ste / gcig tu nges par zag pa med pa'i chos rnams la mngon sum gyi shes pa dang / lkog tu gyur pa'i shes pa dang / gcig tu nges par zag pa dang bcas par rigs pas bskyed pa dang / rigs pas bskyed pa ma yin pa dang /

analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i sems can 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams kyi'o // bdag gi kha na las pa yang ma yin /
