original: gzhan gyi kha na las pa yang ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi kha na las pa yang ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The sin of neither is, for example,

original: srid pa'i rtse mor gtogs pa man chad gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mor gtogs pa man chad gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
translated: that of the beings in the womb of a mother who is a vai≈õya or a ≈õ≈´dra.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa'i lam ste /
translated: The path of purification is fourfold:

original: 'bad pa'i dbang po yang ma rdzogs /
analyzed: 'bad pa'i dbang po yang ma rdzogs /
translated: the faculty of effort is not complete,

original: mngon par dga' ba yang ma rdzogs pa dang / 'bad pa'i dbang po ni rdzogs la mngon par dga' ba ni ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba ni rdzogs la 'bad pa'i dbang po ni ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba yang rdzogs la 'bad pa'i dbang po yang rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yang ma rdzogs pa dang / 'bad pa'i dbang po ni rdzogs la mngon par dga' ba ni ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba ni rdzogs la 'bad pa'i dbang po ni ma rdzogs pa dang / mngon par dga' ba yang rdzogs la 'bad pa'i dbang po yang rdzogs pa'o //
translated: The faculty of perfect knowledge is complete and the faculty of final and perfect knowledge is complete.

original: gzhan yang rnam par dag pa'i lam bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par dag pa'i lam bzhi ste /
translated: Moreover, there are four pure paths:

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la mi phyogs pa dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la mngon du phyogs pa dang / tshogs kyi lam dang / rnam par dag pa'i lam mo //üîΩde la dang po ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams dang / gnod @176a * //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la mi phyogs pa dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la mngon du phyogs pa dang / tshogs kyi lam dang / rnam par dag pa'i lam mo // de la dang po ni 'di ltar 'di na kha cig phyi rol pa'i lta bar gyur pa rnams dang / gnod @176a * //
translated: the path of non-inclination towards the badly taught Dharma and Vinaya, the path of inclination towards the well taught Dharma and Vinaya, the path of accumulation and the pure path.

original: pa dang ldan pa'i dka' thub drag po mi 'dod cing mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: pa dang ldan pa'i dka' thub drag po mi 'dod cing mi bzod pa'o //
translated: The first is as follows: Here, some do not desire and cannot endure the views of non-Buddhists and the severe austerities that are harmful.

original: gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas shing 'dod pa dang bzod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na kha cig phung po dang khams dang skye mched dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa la mkhas shing 'dod pa dang bzod pa ste /
translated: Thus, some here are skilled in the aggregates, elements, sense bases, dependent origination, and what is and is not possible, and they desire and accept.

original: de yang grang ba la sogs pa bzod cing dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: de yang grang ba la sogs pa bzod cing dang du len pa'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: They also have the nature of accepting and tolerating cold and so on.

original: gsum pa ni tshul khrims dang dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa la sogs pa dge ba'i tshogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: gsum pa ni tshul khrims dang dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa la sogs pa dge ba'i tshogs su gtogs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The third is the dharmas belonging to the accumulation of virtue, such as guarding morality and the sense doors.

original: bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ngo //
translated: The fourth is calm abiding and insight for the sake of abandoning afflictions and abiding in bliss in this life.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni slob pa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni slob pa'i lhag pa'i sems kyi sbyor ba ste /
translated: These four are the training in superior mind for trainees.

original: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral bas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas phyir mi 'ong bas /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang ma bral bas phyir mi 'ong ba'i 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / mi lcogs pa med pa la brten nas phyir mi 'ong bas /
translated: The nonreturner who has not become free from attachment to the desire realm in order to attain the fruit of nonreturner and the nonreturner who is based on the unrestricted state

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gi sdig pa spang bar bya ba dang bde 'gror 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag gi nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gi sdig pa spang bar bya ba dang bde 'gror 'gro bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag gi nyon mongs pa thams cad spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to abide in happiness in this life, in order to abandon the sins of others and lead them to good rebirth, and in order to abandon all one‚Äôs own afflictions.

original: las gnyis ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: las gnyis ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that action is of four kinds:

original: 'jug par gtogs pa'i las rnam pa gsum dang / ldog par gtogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: 'jug par gtogs pa'i las rnam pa gsum dang / ldog par gtogs pa'i las so //
translated: action included in the three realms, and action included in transcendence.

original: de la gcig tu nges par mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song du rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: de la gcig tu nges par mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu ni ngan song du rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The first has a definite unpleasant result, ripening in the miserable realms.

original: gcig tu nges par sdug pa'i 'bras bu ni gzugs dang / gzugs med par rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par sdug pa'i 'bras bu ni gzugs dang / gzugs med par rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The second has a definite pleasant result, ripening in the form and formless realms.

original: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mir rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i 'bras bu ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha dang mir rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The third has both pleasant and unpleasant results, ripening in the desire realm as gods and humans.

original: bzhi pa ni las rnam pa gsum char yang spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni las rnam pa gsum char yang spong bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The fourth abandons all three kinds of action.

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi lhag par chags pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi lhag par chags pa ste /
translated: These four are the excessive attachments of sentient beings.

original: bde la mi phan pa dang / phan la mi bde ba dang / phan yang phan la bde yang bde ba dang / phan pa yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde la mi phan pa dang / phan la mi bde ba dang / phan yang phan la bde yang bde ba dang / phan pa yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: that which is pleasant but not beneficial, that which is beneficial but not pleasant, that which is both beneficial and pleasant, and that which is neither beneficial nor pleasant.

original: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni sgo bzhi nas 'jug cing skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa ni sgo bzhi nas 'jug cing skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: The afflictions of sentient beings arise and enter through four doors, and they encounter the suffering of birth, etc.

original: 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i sgo dang / gzugs dang gzugs @176b med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la lhag par chags pa'i sgo dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi lta ba'i sgo dang / chos 'di pa chos kyi mig ma thob pa rnams kyi mi shes pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i sgo dang / gzugs dang gzugs @176b med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la lhag par chags pa'i sgo dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rnams kyi lta ba'i sgo dang / chos 'di pa chos kyi mig ma thob pa rnams kyi mi shes pa'i sgo'o //
translated: The door of excessive attachment to sense objects, the door of excessive attachment to the meditative states of the form and formless realms, the door of the views of non-Buddhists, and the door of ignorance of those within this religion who have not obtained the eye of Dharma.

original: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa ni sgo bzhi po de nyid kyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam bsgom pa ni sgo bzhi po de nyid kyi sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The cultivation of the noble path is the freedom from the suffering of those very four doors.

original: sdug bsngal dang phrad pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang phrad pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as with the encounter with suffering,

original: rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba dang / yang srid pa pa'i las nye bar len pa dang / rnam par dgrol dka' ba'i phyir yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyun phyogs su 'gro ba dang / yang srid pa pa'i las nye bar len pa dang / rnam par dgrol dka' ba'i phyir yang de dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is like a river flowing in one direction, like the appropriation of karma that leads to rebirth, and like the difficulty of being liberated.

original: gang zag bzhi po 'di dag ni gang zag thams cad 'dus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag bzhi po 'di dag ni gang zag thams cad 'dus par rig par bya ste /
translated: These four types of persons include all persons:

original: so so'i skye bo dang / slob par 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / slob par 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'jig tshogs las yang dag par 'das pa'i mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / slob par 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang ma bral ba dang / slob par 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'jig tshogs las yang dag par 'das pa'i mi slob pa'o //
translated: the ordinary person, the one who is not free from desire who is desirous of learning, the one who is free from desire who is desirous of learning, and the one who is beyond the perishing aggregates who is not desirous of learning.

original: gzhan yang gang zag bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag bzhi ste /
translated: There are four other types of persons:

original: bdag nyid sdom pa la gnas la gzhan dag la chos mi ston pa dang / bdag nyid sdom pa la mi gnas la gzhan la yang chos ston pa dang / gnyi ga byed pa dang / gnyi ga mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdom pa la gnas la gzhan dag la chos mi ston pa dang / bdag nyid sdom pa la mi gnas la gzhan la yang chos ston pa dang / gnyi ga byed pa dang / gnyi ga mi byed pa'o //
translated: the one who himself abides in the vow but does not teach the Dharma to others, the one who does not abide in the vow but teaches the Dharma to others, the one who does both, and the one who does neither.

original: gang zag ni bzhi yod de rigs dma' la chos dkar po kun du spyod pa dang / rigs bzang la sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa dang / rigs dma' la sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa dang / rigs bzang la chos dkar po kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag ni bzhi yod de rigs dma' la chos dkar po kun du spyod pa dang / rigs bzang la sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa dang / rigs dma' la sdig pa'i chos kun du spyod pa dang / rigs bzang la chos dkar po kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: There are four kinds of persons: those of low family who practice the bright actions, those of good family who practice evil actions, those of low family who practice evil actions, and those of good family who practice the bright actions.

original: de la dang po ni tshe 'di la sdug bsngal la tshe phyi ma la ma yin no //üîΩgnyis pa ni tshe phyi ma la sdug bsngal la /
analyzed: de la dang po ni tshe 'di la sdug bsngal la tshe phyi ma la ma yin no // gnyis pa ni tshe phyi ma la sdug bsngal la /
translated: The first of these is unhappy in this life but not in the next;

original: tshe 'di la ma yin no /
analyzed: tshe 'di la ma yin no /
translated: the second is unhappy in the next life but not in this one;

original: gsum pa ni gnyi gar sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyi gar sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: the third is unhappy in both;

original: bzhi pa ni gnyi gar bde ba'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni gnyi gar bde ba'o //
translated: the fourth is happy in both.

original: yang gang zag bzhi yod de /
analyzed: yang gang zag bzhi yod de /
translated: Again, there are four kinds of persons:

original: bdag nyid sdug bsngal la sbyor bar byed la pha rol ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid sdug bsngal la sbyor bar byed la pha rol ni ma yin te /
translated: those who make themselves unhappy but not others;

original: bsod nams bskyed pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste dka' thub drag po can lta bu'o //üîΩpha rol sdug bsngal la sbyor bar byed la /
analyzed: bsod nams bskyed pa ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste dka' thub drag po can lta bu'o // pha rol sdug bsngal la sbyor bar byed la /
translated: those who do not produce merit, such as the one who practices severe austerities;

original: bdag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni ma yin te /
translated: those who make others unhappy but not themselves;üîΩthose who make neither themselves nor others unhappy;üîΩand those who make both themselves and others unhappy.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa yang bskyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa yang bskyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The generation of demerit is, for example,

original: sdom pa can ma yin pa rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa can ma yin pa rnams las gang yang rung ba'o //
translated: any action of those who are not restrained.

original: gnyi ga sdug bsngal la sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: gnyi ga sdug bsngal la sbyor bar byed de /
translated: Both are applied to suffering,

original: bsod nams ma yin pa yang skyed pa ni 'di lta ste //üîΩrgyal po mchog sbyin @177a * //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa yang skyed pa ni 'di lta ste // rgyal po mchog sbyin @177a * //
translated: and the generation of demerit is, for example,

original: gyi bdag po'i rta skye ba'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gyi bdag po'i rta skye ba'i mchod sbyin la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the horse sacrifice of the king Var·π£akƒÅra.

original: bdag dang pha rol sdug bsngal la sbyor bar mi byed de /
analyzed: bdag dang pha rol sdug bsngal la sbyor bar mi byed de /
translated: Both are applied to suffering,

original: bsod nams kyang bskyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyang bskyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: and the generation of merit is, for example,

original: gang zag bsam gtan la gnas pa sdig pa thams cad spangs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: gang zag bsam gtan la gnas pa sdig pa thams cad spangs pa lta bu'o //
translated: the person who, abiding in the meditative absorptions, abandons all evil.

original: ngag gi nyes pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ngag gi nyes pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The faults of speech are, in brief, fourfold:

original: log pa dang / 'byed pa dang / yon tan med pa dang / don med pa'o /
analyzed: log pa dang / 'byed pa dang / yon tan med pa dang / don med pa'o /
translated: false, divisive, harsh, and nonsensical speech.

original: de las bzlog pa ni yon tan du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni yon tan du rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these should be understood as the virtues.

original: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i log pa'i tshig ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste ma mthong ba'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa ma yin pa'i log pa'i tshig ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhi ste ma mthong ba'am /
translated: The speech of those who are not noble is, in brief, of four types:

original: yang na ma mthong na phyin ci log tu smra ba dang / thos pa dang bye brag byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na ma mthong na phyin ci log tu smra ba dang / thos pa dang bye brag byed pa dang / rnam par shes pa la yang de bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: that which is spoken without having seen, or without having heard, or without having discerned, or without having known.

original: de las bzlog pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshig yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩsangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas bzhi bzhi pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni 'phags pa'i bden pa'i tshig yin par rig par bya'o // sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas bzhi bzhi pa rdzogs so /
translated: The opposite of that is the speech of the noble ones.

original: // / lnga po 'di dag ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyi phyogs gnas ngan len gyi rjes su 'brangs pas 'jug pa kun nas nyon mongs par gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: // / lnga po 'di dag ni 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags kyi phyogs gnas ngan len gyi rjes su 'brangs pas 'jug pa kun nas nyon mongs par gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs te /
translated: The fifth is a collection of motivating dispositions that are associated with the defilement process, because they follow the current of negative tendencies that are related to desire and passion.

original: rten dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed kyi tshogs dang / myong ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / tha snyad kyi gnas skabs yongs su bcad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rten dang yul gyi ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed kyi tshogs dang / myong ba'i ngo bo nyid dang / tha snyad kyi gnas skabs yongs su bcad pa'i phyir /
translated: They are a collection of motivating dispositions that are related to the essential nature of a basis and an object, to the essential nature of experience, and to the determination of the occasion of verbal expression.

original: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed kyi tshogs so //üîΩde las bzlog pa lnga ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi phyogs gnas ngan len dang bral ba /
analyzed: mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi 'du byed kyi tshogs so // de las bzlog pa lnga ni 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi phyogs gnas ngan len dang bral ba /
translated: The five kinds of objects of desire are the aggregates of the formations that are the nature of grasping at signs, the nature of activity, and the nature of objects.

original: ldog pa rnam par byang bar gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs yin par rig par bya'o //üîΩlnga po 'di dag ni yongs su btsal zhing longs par spyod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa rnam par byang bar gtogs pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs yin par rig par bya'o // lnga po 'di dag ni yongs su btsal zhing longs par spyod pa'i phyir /
translated: The five kinds of things that are their opposites are the aggregates of the formations that are associated with purification, which are free from the impurities of aspiration and attachment.

original: 'dod pa can rnams kyi 'dod par bya ba'i yul dang / 'dod pa la mi phyogs pa rnams kyi yang dag par nye bar brtag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa can rnams kyi 'dod par bya ba'i yul dang / 'dod pa la mi phyogs pa rnams kyi yang dag par nye bar brtag par bya ba yin te /
translated: These five are objects of desire for those who are desirous, and they are also objects of thorough investigation for those who are not desirous.

original: gzugs rnams dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg bya rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs rnams dang / sgra rnams dang / dri rnams dang / ro rnams dang / reg bya rnams so //
translated: They are forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tangible objects.

original: de la btsal bar bya ba dang / brtag par bya ba dang / lhag par chags par bya ba'i dngos po las brtsams te /
analyzed: de la btsal bar bya ba dang / brtag par bya ba dang / lhag par chags par bya ba'i dngos po las brtsams te /
translated: In this regard, the five kinds of objects of desire are to be sought out and enjoyed.

original: 'dod par bya ba rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba rnam pa bzhi yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: There are four kinds of desirable things.

original: de la ma 'ongs pa @177b 'dod par bya ba ni btsal ba'o //
analyzed: de la ma 'ongs pa @177b 'dod par bya ba ni btsal ba'o //
translated: The desirable thing of the future is the search.

original: 'das pa ni rtag pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa ni rtag pa'o //
translated: The desirable thing of the past is the constant.

original: da ltar byung ba ni lhag par chags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni lhag par chags par bya ba'o //
translated: The desirable thing of the present is the attachment.

original: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And this is twofold:

original: dngos po 'dod par bya ba dang / de las skyes pa'i tshor ba 'dod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po 'dod par bya ba dang / de las skyes pa'i tshor ba 'dod par bya ba'o //
translated: the desirable thing as object and the desirable thing as the feeling that arises from it.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa nye bar spyad pa'i phyir lus thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa nye bar spyad pa'i phyir lus thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: These five are the desirable things of sentient beings.

original: lha dang mi dang / sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi yul pa'o //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang / sems can dmyal ba pa dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi yul pa'o //
translated: They are the desirable things of gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: rnyed pa'i rgyu sgrub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi phyogs pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa'i rgyu sgrub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa la mi phyogs pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The five causes of acquisition should be understood as the cause of acquisition of the body, the cause of the non-abandonment of the body, the cause of the enjoyment of the body, the cause of the non-distraction of the body, and the cause of the non-confusion of the body.üîΩThe five causes of non-acquisition should be understood as the cause of the non-acquisition of the body, the cause of the abandonment of the body, the cause of the non-enjoyment of the body, the cause of the distraction of the body, and the cause of the confusion of the body.

original: gang du longs spyad pa dang / gang las rnyed pa dang / gang rnyed pa dang / gang gi phyir rnyed pa dang / ji lta bus rnyed pa ste /
analyzed: gang du longs spyad pa dang / gang las rnyed pa dang / gang rnyed pa dang / gang gi phyir rnyed pa dang / ji lta bus rnyed pa ste /
translated: Where one enjoys, from what one obtains, what one obtains, for what reason one obtains, and in what manner one obtains.

original: gnas 'di dag tu sems kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gnas 'di dag tu sems kun du 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: These are the points on which the mind is held.

original: chos lnga po 'di dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa la gnod pa sngon du 'gro bas zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang mi mthun pa ste /
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag ni rnal 'byor pa'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa la gnod pa sngon du 'gro bas zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong dang mi mthun pa ste /
translated: These five dharmas are adverse to the morality, learning, serenity, and insight of a yogin.

original: 'dod pa rnams la chags pa dang / skul ba dang / dran pa byed pa dang / 'doms pa dang / rjes su ston pa rnams la kun nas mnar sems dang / khong khro ba'i sems su byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la chags pa dang / skul ba dang / dran pa byed pa dang / 'doms pa dang / rjes su ston pa rnams la kun nas mnar sems dang / khong khro ba'i sems su byed pa ste /
translated: They are: to be full of malice and anger toward those who admonish, remind, instruct, and teach;

original: tshul khrims yang dag par ma blangs pa ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par ma blangs pa ni /
translated: to not take up morality;

original: yang dag par mi len pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par blangs pa ni spong ba'am nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par mi len pa'i phyir dang / yang dag par blangs pa ni spong ba'am nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: to abandon or violate that which has been taken up;

original: gnyid dang / nyal ba dang / mngon par ma zhi ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi 'gyod pa dang chos rnams la som nyi byed de /
analyzed: gnyid dang / nyal ba dang / mngon par ma zhi ba dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi 'gyod pa dang chos rnams la som nyi byed de /
translated: sleep, lying down, lack of tranquility, remorse, and doubt about the Dharma.

original: thos pa ma bzung ba ni 'dzin par mi byed la /
analyzed: thos pa ma bzung ba ni 'dzin par mi byed la /
translated: One does not retain what one has not heard,

original: bzung pa ni brjed par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bzung pa ni brjed par 'gyur zhing /
translated: and what one has retained is forgotten.

original: ma brjed pa yang nges par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ma brjed pa yang nges par rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And what has not been forgotten is not understood with certainty.

original: 'og ma'i cha ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha ni gnyis te /
translated: The two lower portions are:

original: mthong ba'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'og ma'i cha'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ni bsgom pa'i lam gyi 'og ma'i cha'o //
translated: the path of seeing is the lower portion of the path of cultivation.

original: 'dod pa'i khams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'og ma'i cha'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i 'og ma'i cha'o //
translated: The desire realm is the lower portion of the form and formless realms.

original: 'og ma'i cha 'di gnyis la brten nas 'og ma'i cha lnga la kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha 'di gnyis la brten nas 'og ma'i cha lnga la kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Based on these two lower portions, the five lower fetters are taught.

original: 'og ma'i cha dang po las brtsams pa ni /
analyzed: 'og ma'i cha dang po las brtsams pa ni /
translated: Beginning with the first lower portion,

original: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa dang / the tshom mo //
translated: there is the view of the transitory collection, holding a discipline and ritual to be paramount, and doubt.

original: gnyis pa las @178a * //
analyzed: gnyis pa las @178a * //
translated: From the second,

original: brtsams pa ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod pa'i sems so //
analyzed: brtsams pa ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod pa'i sems so //
translated: The two that are the beginning are will for sense-pleasures and malice.

original: 'di gnyis ni gong ma'i cha ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni gong ma'i cha ste /
translated: These two are the higher part.

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams so //
translated: The form realm and the formless realm.

original: gong ma'i cha 'di gnyis la brten nas /
analyzed: gong ma'i cha 'di gnyis la brten nas /
translated: In dependence on these two higher parts,

original: gong ma'i cha lnga la kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gong ma'i cha lnga la kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: there are five higher parts that are called fetters.

original: kun du sbyor ba bye brag med pa ni /
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba bye brag med pa ni /
translated: The fetter that is not distinguished is

original: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi 'dod chags dang / gzugs med pa'i 'dod chags so //
translated: attachment to form and attachment to the formless.

original: kun du sbyor ba bye brag can ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i rgod pa dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba bye brag can ni sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i rgod pa dang / nga rgyal shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i ma rig pa'o //
translated: The fetter that is distinguished is the agitation of the meditative stabilization of one with a predominance of craving, the pride of the meditative stabilization of one with a predominance of pride, and the ignorance of the meditative stabilization of one with a predominance of ignorance.

original: ma gus pa rnam pa lngas yongs su zin na /
analyzed: ma gus pa rnam pa lngas yongs su zin na /
translated: When one is completely taken hold of by five kinds of disrespect,

original: sems las su mi rung zhing /
analyzed: sems las su mi rung zhing /
translated: the mind is not workable

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: and the roots of virtue do not grow.

original: ston pa po dang / bstan pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang / yang dag par bskul zhing rjes su 'doms la ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa po dang / bstan pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang / yang dag par bskul zhing rjes su 'doms la ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la ma gus pa'o //
translated: the teacher, the teaching, the training in higher morality, the training in higher thought, the training in higher wisdom, the exhortation and instruction of others, and the lack of respect for one's fellow brahmacarins.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spang bar yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i bar du gcod pa ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni nyon mongs pa spang bar yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i bar du gcod pa ste /
translated: These five are the obstacles to the practice of right effort to eliminate the defilements.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba la lhag par chags pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pa dang / bag med pa dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab dang / sems zhum pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa dang / skye ba la lhag par chags pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti la lhag par chags pa dang / bag med pa dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab dang / sems zhum pa dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: They are: attachment to meditative absorption, attachment to gain and honor, heedlessness, false wisdom, mental depression, and overweening pride.

original: bzod pa med pa'i skyes bu gang zag la ni /
analyzed: bzod pa med pa'i skyes bu gang zag la ni /
translated: The person who is impatient

original: pha rol phyir rgol ba la log par sgrub pa rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol phyir rgol ba la log par sgrub pa rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: has five kinds of perverse practices against his adversaries.

original: 'di la bzod pa med pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bzod pa med pa ni /
translated: He is impatient

original: pha rol phyir rgol ba la log par sgrub pa rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol phyir rgol ba la log par sgrub pa rnam pa lnga yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that there are five kinds of perverse practice in relation to an adversary.

original: 'di la bzod pa med pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la bzod pa med pa ni /
translated: Lack of patience is the first perverse practice.

original: pha rol phyir rgol ba la thog ma kho nar kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan par 'gyur te /üîΩkhon gyi bsam pa dang / de'i mdza' bo'i skye bo dang / yang dbye bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: pha rol phyir rgol ba la thog ma kho nar kun nas mnar sems kyi sems dang ldan par 'gyur te / khon gyi bsam pa dang / de'i mdza' bo'i skye bo dang / yang dbye bar 'dod cing /
translated: From the very beginning, one has a hostile attitude toward an adversary.

original: 'byed pa dang / de bzhin du gnod par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas /
analyzed: 'byed pa dang / de bzhin du gnod par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pas /
translated: One wishes to harm him, to separate him from his friends, to cause him to be divided, and to cause him to be harmed.

original: de la sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba yang sgrub pa dang / bdag gis yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims @178b kyang nyams par byed pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis kyang nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod par 'gyur te /üîΩlog par bsgrub pa rnam pa lnga po de dag ni 'dir skyes na yang /
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba yang sgrub pa dang / bdag gis yang dag par blangs pa'i tshul khrims @178b kyang nyams par byed pa dang / lus dang ngag dang yid rnams kyis kyang nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod par 'gyur te / log par bsgrub pa rnam pa lnga po de dag ni 'dir skyes na yang /
translated: One causes him to suffer and to be unhappy, one causes him to violate the morality he has undertaken, and one causes him to commit evil deeds with his body, speech, and mind.

original: 'di rgyu mthun pa'i nyes dmigs gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di rgyu mthun pa'i nyes dmigs gsum yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: These five kinds of perverse practice are the three kinds of misfortune that are natural consequences of such practice.

original: dgra mang ba dang / mdza' po dang / dbye ba dang / pha rol pos sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde bar gyur pa'i mi 'dod pa rnam pa sna tshogs kun du spyod pa'o //üîΩgcig ni tshe 'di'i ste /üîΩ'chi ba'i tshe 'gyod par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩgcig ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'i tshe phyi ma'i ste /

original: nye du rnams phung ste 'chi ba'i dus byed pa dang / longs spyod kyi gzhi rnams tshul ma yin par chud za ba dang / rang gi lus la nad byung ba 'di gsum ni tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nye du rnams phung ste 'chi ba'i dus byed pa dang / longs spyod kyi gzhi rnams tshul ma yin par chud za ba dang / rang gi lus la nad byung ba 'di gsum ni tshe 'di'i sdug bsngal ba dang yid mi bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: These three are the suffering and mental unhappiness that arise in this life: the loss of wealth through improper use, the loss of relatives through death, and the loss of one‚Äôs own health through illness.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / thams cad la yang skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba ni tshe phyi ma'o //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / thams cad la yang skur pa 'debs pa'i log par lta ba ni tshe phyi ma'o //
translated: Immoral conduct and the wrong view that denies everything are the suffering and mental unhappiness that arise in the next life.

original: de las bzlog pa'i chos lnga po rnams ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la bde ba dang yid bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i chos lnga po rnams ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma la bde ba dang yid bde ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five qualities that are the opposite of these are to be understood as the happiness and mental pleasure that arise in this life and the next.

original: rnam pa lngas gzhan dag gi don bya bar 'dod pa'i skul ba yongs su dag cing yongs su byang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas gzhan dag gi don bya bar 'dod pa'i skul ba yongs su dag cing yongs su byang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In five ways, the urging of others to do what is beneficial becomes pure and completely purified.

original: 'gal bar byas pa ma nor bar smra ba dang / sems dang mthun par smra ba dang / bya ba byed pa smra ba dang / ngag gi nyes pa rnam par spangs nas smra ba dang / yid kyi nyes pa rnam par spangs nas smra ba'o//
analyzed: 'gal bar byas pa ma nor bar smra ba dang / sems dang mthun par smra ba dang / bya ba byed pa smra ba dang / ngag gi nyes pa rnam par spangs nas smra ba dang / yid kyi nyes pa rnam par spangs nas smra ba'o//
translated: speaking without error, in a way that is consistent with the Dharma; speaking in a way that is consistent with the minds of others; speaking in a way that is consistent with the performance of actions; speaking in a way that is free of the faults of speech; and speaking in a way that is free of the faults of mind.

original: dgra bcom pa ni longs spyod pa tshol zhing longs spyod par snang du zin kyang /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa ni longs spyod pa tshol zhing longs spyod par snang du zin kyang /
translated: Even though an Arhat may be seen to pursue and enjoy wealth,

original: log par tshol ba rnam pa gsum las 'das pa dang / log par longs spyod pa rnam pa gnyis las 'das par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: log par tshol ba rnam pa gsum las 'das pa dang / log par longs spyod pa rnam pa gnyis las 'das par rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that he or she is beyond the three kinds of wrong pursuits and the two kinds of wrong enjoyment.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang ldan @179a * //üîΩpa'i log pa'i tshol ba las kyang 'das la /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang ldan @179a * // pa'i log pa'i tshol ba las kyang 'das la /
translated: He or she is beyond the wrong pursuits of killing, stealing, and lying.

original: chung ma 'chang ba dang / bag med par sogs pa'i log par longs spyod pa las kyang 'das so //
analyzed: chung ma 'chang ba dang / bag med par sogs pa'i log par longs spyod pa las kyang 'das so //
translated: He or she is also beyond the wrong enjoyment of sexual intercourse and the wrong enjoyment of negligence.

original: spong ba po ni chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan na dge ba'i phyogs la ci dgar sbyor ba dang mngon par shes pa myur ba yin te /
analyzed: spong ba po ni chos rnam pa lnga dang ldan na dge ba'i phyogs la ci dgar sbyor ba dang mngon par shes pa myur ba yin te /
translated: The one who abandons has five qualities: he is able to apply himself to virtue as he wishes and his superknowledges are swift.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i spong ba 'dun pa drag po dang / sgrub pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gi brjod pa dang / lus kyi nyams stobs dang / rgyun du chud pa dang / gus par sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi spro ba dang /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i spong ba 'dun pa drag po dang / sgrub pa ji lta ba bzhin du bdag gi brjod pa dang / lus kyi nyams stobs dang / rgyun du chud pa dang / gus par sbyor ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyi spro ba dang /
translated: He has strong aspiration for the abandonment taught above, he is able to practice as taught, he has physical strength, he is able to persevere, and he has mental enthusiasm that is applied with respect.

original: zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma'i dus /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang rab tu 'dzin pa dang / btang snyoms kyi mtshan ma'i dus /
translated: He has the signs of serenity, insight, and equanimity.

original: so sor rig pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: so sor rig pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: He has the knowledge of discerning them.

original: chos lnga po 'di dag ni rnam par grol ba yongs su rtogs par byed pa skyo ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rig par bya ste /üîΩchos rnams la rmongs pa rnam pa gsum la brten nas /
analyzed: chos lnga po 'di dag ni rnam par grol ba yongs su rtogs par byed pa skyo ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rig par bya ste / chos rnams la rmongs pa rnam pa gsum la brten nas /
translated: These five qualities are to be known as the antidotes to the five faults that prevent the realization of liberation.üîΩThere are three kinds of confusion about phenomena:

original: phyin ci log rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: based on these three kinds of confusion, there are three kinds of errors.

original: dus la rmongs pa dang gnas skabs la rmongs pa dang / ngo bo nyid la rmongs pa la brten nas /
analyzed: dus la rmongs pa dang gnas skabs la rmongs pa dang / ngo bo nyid la rmongs pa la brten nas /
translated: The five kinds of false notions are the false notions of permanence, pleasure, purity, and self with regard to the impermanent, the painful, the impure, and the insubstantial, and the false notion of acquisition with regard to the non-acquired.

original: mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa dang / rnyed pa la rab dang / srog la re ba'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la rtag par phyin ci log pa dang / sdug bsngal la bde bar phyin ci log pa dang / bdag med pa la bdag tu phyin ci log pa dang / rnyed pa la rab dang / srog la re ba'o //
translated: The five kinds of adverse elements are the five kinds of false notions.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gi gnyen po las mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa lnga po 'di dag gi gnyen po las mtshan mar 'dzin pa rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The five kinds of counteractions to these five kinds of adverse elements should be known as the five kinds of grasping of signs.

original: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal bar mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / chos thams cad la bdag med pa dang / zas la mi mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang po la 'gag par mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal bar mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / chos thams cad la bdag med pa dang / zas la mi mthun pa dang / srog gi dbang po la 'gag par mtshan mar 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They are the grasping of signs of impermanence and of suffering with regard to all conditioned things, the grasping of signs of the insubstantiality of all things, the grasping of signs of the unpleasantness of food, and the grasping of signs of the cessation of the life faculty.

original: lnga po 'di dag ni ting nge 'dzin dang / shes pas rab tu phye ba'i rnal 'byor pa gnyis kyi sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skye ba'i sgo yin te /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni ting nge 'dzin dang / shes pas rab tu phye ba'i rnal 'byor pa gnyis kyi sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba'i skye ba'i sgo yin te /
translated: These five are the doors of birth for the mind liberation of the two kinds of yogis, those distinguished by concentration and those distinguished by wisdom.

original: rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin gtso bor byed pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ting nge 'dzin gtso bor byed pa /
translated: The yogi who emphasizes concentration

original: bden pa'i gnas kyi gtam thos nas chos dang don legs par rig pa dang / ji ltar thob pa de bzhin du go bar byed pa'i sgras kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la don yang dag par ston pa dang / lkog na 'dug cing sems te chos dang don legs par rig pa dang /
analyzed: bden pa'i gnas kyi gtam thos nas chos dang don legs par rig pa dang / ji ltar thob pa de bzhin du go bar byed pa'i sgras kha ton byed pa dang / gzhan dag la don yang dag par ston pa dang / lkog na 'dug cing sems te chos dang don legs par rig pa dang /
translated: hears the Dharma teachings on the abodes of truth, understands the Dharma and its meaning, recites the teachings as he has heard them, teaches the meaning to others, reflects on the Dharma and its meaning while alone, and meditates on the Dharma and its meaning.

original: @179b rnal 'byor pa shes pa gtso bor byed pa'i shas cher rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi gnyen po legs par yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: @179b rnal 'byor pa shes pa gtso bor byed pa'i shas cher rnam par g-yeng bar byed pa 'dod pa la 'dod chags kyi gnyen po legs par yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The yogi who emphasizes wisdom should properly attend to the antidote to attachment to sense objects, which is the cause of distraction.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i bsam pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i bsam pa dang / sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The perfection of the yogi's thought and application should be known as fivefold.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub la mngon par yid ches pa drag po ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang / byang chub la mngon par yid ches pa drag po ni bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The intense conviction in nirvana and enlightenment is the perfection of attitude.

original: rtag tu gus par byed pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtag tu gus par byed pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ni sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: The constant respect, the practice with full awareness, and the serenity and insight are the perfection of application.

original: chos lnga ni sems can rnams kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i las byed pa'i 'bras bu nye bar spyad pa dang / lus dang sems kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad sdud par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: chos lnga ni sems can rnams kyi sdug pa dang mi sdug pa'i las byed pa'i 'bras bu nye bar spyad pa dang / lus dang sems kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba dang / sdug bsngal thams cad sdud par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The five dharmas are the experience of the fruit of the good and bad actions of beings, the defilement of body and mind, and the attraction of all suffering.

original: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms so //
analyzed: bde ba dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid bde ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / btang snyoms so //
translated: They are pleasure, pain, joy, sorrow, and indifference.

original: snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor pa bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i phyir mi ldog pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa ni myur ba myur bar bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnal 'byor pa bsam pa dang / sbyor ba'i phyir mi ldog pa rnam pa lnga dang ldan pa ni myur ba myur bar bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur zhing /
translated: The yogi who is endowed with the five kinds of non-regression, as before, in terms of attitude and application, becomes fit for the rapid realization of the truth.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la shin tu bstan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la shin tu bstan par 'gyur ba'o //

original: lnga po 'di dag ni slob pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i bye brag ste /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni slob pa'i 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral la kun du sbyor ba'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i bye brag ste /

original: yang na ni bar ma do'i srid pa la gnas pa nyid kyi tshe mthar thug pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /
analyzed: yang na ni bar ma do'i srid pa la gnas pa nyid kyi tshe mthar thug pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba'am /

analyzed: yang na ni bsam gtan dang por skyes ma thag kho nar mthar thug pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' 'am /
translated: Or they attain nirvana through final nirvƒÅ·πáa immediately after they are born in the first absorption.

analyzed: yang na ni skyes nas tshegs chung ngus lam mngon sum du byas pa 'am /

original: chos dang chos ma yin pa yang byed la /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin pa yang byed la /
translated: One practices virtue and non-virtue.

original: sdug pa'i dngos po dang phrad pa dang / gnas pa dang phyir zhing 'byung bar 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa'i dngos po dang mi phrad pa dang / mi gnas pa dang / med par 'gyur bar 'dod pa sngon byung ba gang yin pa de de'i dus na 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //

translated: One desires to meet with pleasant things, to remain with them, and to have them occur again. One desires not to meet with unpleasant things, not to remain with them, and for them not to occur again.

original: dkon mchog dang / bslab par gtogs pa rnam pa drug la khyad du gsod ba ni dge ba'i chos ma thob pa las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dkon mchog dang / bslab par gtogs pa rnam pa drug la khyad du gsod ba ni dge ba'i chos ma thob pa las kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: One despises the six types of things that are related to the Jewels and training. One degenerates from the virtue that one has not obtained.

original: thob pa las kyang yongs su nyams pa dang / bstan pa yang yongs su gtod pa dang / tha na sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun rnams dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rnams la dad pa tsam yang tnyams par 'gyur ba'o //

translated: and also from loss of what has been acquired, and from the loss of the teaching, and even from the loss of mere faith in the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha, and in the morality, concentration, and wisdom of others.

original: de la sdig pa'i grogs pos ni lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab las brtsams te 'doms shing ston pa log par rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sdig pa'i grogs pos ni lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab las brtsams te 'doms shing ston pa log par rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, one finds a false instructor in the higher thought and the higher insight, through the influence of a bad friend.

original: bka' blo mi bde bas ni rnyed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde bas ni rnyed par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One does not find an instructor through the influence of a bad teacher.

original: de log par gyur pa dang / rnyed par yang ma gyur pas dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log par gyur pa dang / rnyed par yang ma gyur pas dge ba'i chos rnams las yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: One degenerates from the wholesome dharmas through the loss of the instructor and the loss of the instruction.

original: de las bzlog pa ni dge ba'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni dge ba'i phyogs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as the wholesome side.

original: drug po 'di dag ni 'dod chags kyi gzhi yin zhing /
analyzed: drug po 'di dag ni 'dod chags kyi gzhi yin zhing /

analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan la / gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams la /
translated: When the mind of sentient beings is associated with incorrect mental activity,

analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems bde bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs yin no // ji ltar 'dod chags kyi gzhi yin zhing /

original: gnas kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gnas kyang rung ste /

original: mig gis shes par bya ba gzugs rnams dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba chos kyi bar dag la /
analyzed: mig gis shes par bya ba gzugs rnams dang / yid kyis shes par bya ba chos kyi bar dag la /

analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi dang nam mkha'i khams dang rnam par shes pa'o //

original: de la rnam par shes pa ni 'dir bsod nams dang / bsod nams ma yin pa bstsags pa /

original: gong na med pa dag yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gong na med pa dag yod par rig par bya ste /

original: yongs su grub par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub par 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //

analyzed: 'jug par byed pa dang / gnas pa dang / mthun pa dang / sdud par byed pa'o //
