original: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba sbyin pa yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / de dag nyid la brten nas khyim gyi gnas ni kun du gnod @183a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba sbyin pa yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang / de dag nyid la brten nas khyim gyi gnas ni kun du gnod @183a * //
translated: The mundane correct view is the aspect of generosity and so on, and based on that, the household is the basis for

original: pa'o // khyim ni skyon yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: pa'o // khyim ni skyon yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspects of the truths are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized.

original: mngon par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni 'jug par byed pa'o //üîΩzhugs zin nas yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las dang 'tsho ba yang dag par blangs pa ni gnas pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'byung ba dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i rtog pa ni 'jug par byed pa'o // zhugs zin nas yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las dang 'tsho ba yang dag par blangs pa ni gnas pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: The aspects of the truths that are to be realized are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the three vehicles.üîΩThe aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the three vehicles are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples, the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the hermit buddhas, and the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the bodhisattvas.üîΩThe aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples who are of the sravaka lineage, the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples who are of the solitary-realizer lineage, and the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples who are of the bodhisattva lineage.

original: 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu dang / gnas pa dang mthun pa'i rgyu de'i 'og tu tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / dran pa gang yin pa de ni sdud par byed pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i rgyu dang / gnas pa dang mthun pa'i rgyu de'i 'og tu tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pa na yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / dran pa gang yin pa de ni sdud par byed pa'i rgyu yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples who are of the sravaka lineage are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by those who are of the sravaka lineage and who are of the fixed condition of being a sravaka.

original: 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa rnams ni 'di lta bu'i phyir nor sogs par 'dod de /üîΩ'di ltar bde ba 'dod pa kho na'i phyir yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa la nye bar spyod pa rnams ni 'di lta bu'i phyir nor sogs par 'dod de / 'di ltar bde ba 'dod pa kho na'i phyir yin la /
translated: The aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples who are of the solitary-realizer lineage are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by those who are of the solitary-realizer lineage and who are of the fixed condition of being a solitary-realizer.

original: bde ba bdun po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun las byung ba ste /
analyzed: bde ba bdun po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i nor bdun las byung ba ste /
translated: The aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the disciples who are of the bodhisattva lineage are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by those who are of the bodhisattva lineage and who are of the fixed condition of being a bodhisattva.üîΩThe aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the bodhisattvas are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the bodhisattvas who are of the bodhisattva lineage, the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the bodhisattvas who are of the solitary-realizer lineage, and the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the bodhisattvas who are of the sravaka lineage.üîΩThe aspects of the truths that are to be realized by the bodhisattvas who are of the bodhisattva lineage are the aspects of the truths that are to be realized by those who are of the bodhisattva lineage and who are of the fixed condition of being a bodhisattva

original: de dag ni phal pa'i nor kun du bsags pa thams cad kyis thob par mi 'gyur pa ste /üîΩdang ba dang ldan pa'i bde ba dang / bde 'gror skye ba las byung ba dang / bdag gi cha ma yin pa la ltos nas /üîΩkha na ma tho ba kun du mi spyod pas 'gyod pa med pa las byung ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan gyis smad pa la ltos pa dang / chos dang don legs par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba dang / phyi ma la yo byad dang mi ldan pa med pa las byung ba dang /
analyzed: de dag ni phal pa'i nor kun du bsags pa thams cad kyis thob par mi 'gyur pa ste / dang ba dang ldan pa'i bde ba dang / bde 'gror skye ba las byung ba dang / bdag gi cha ma yin pa la ltos nas / kha na ma tho ba kun du mi spyod pas 'gyod pa med pa las byung ba dang / de bzhin du gzhan gyis smad pa la ltos pa dang / chos dang don legs par rtogs pa dang ldan pa'i bde ba dang / phyi ma la yo byad dang mi ldan pa med pa las byung ba dang /
translated: One does not obtain these through any accumulation of ordinary wealth.

original: don dam pa rtogs pa las byung ba'i bde ba ste /
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs pa las byung ba'i bde ba ste /
translated: The joy of faith, the joy of being born in a happy realm, the joy of being free of regret because one does not engage in misdeeds, the joy of being free of the reproach of others, the joy of understanding the Dharma and its meaning well, the joy of not being devoid of requisites in future lives and the joy of realizing the ultimate truth.

original: rnam pa du ma kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba 'di dag ni /
analyzed: rnam pa du ma kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bde ba 'di dag ni /
translated: These many kinds of irreproachable joy

original: 'jig rten pa'i nor kun du bsags pa las rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i nor kun du bsags pa las rnam pa thams cad kyi thams cad du thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: are not obtained through any accumulation of ordinary wealth.

original: gzhan du na tshe 'di nyid la yo byad kyis mi brel ba las byung ba tsam du zad la de yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na tshe 'di nyid la yo byad kyis mi brel ba las byung ba tsam du zad la de yang kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it would be merely not being troubled by material things in this life, and that is also with reprehensible action.

original: bdun po 'di dag ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi stobs yin te /
analyzed: bdun po 'di dag ni bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi stobs yin te /
translated: These seven are the powers of the side of Mara and the afflictions.

original: bstan pa la gnod par byed pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pa dang / bdag gi cha ma yin par mi lta ste /
analyzed: bstan pa la gnod par byed pa dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pa dang / bdag gi cha ma yin par mi lta ste /
translated: One does not see the harm in harming the doctrine, in engaging in misdeeds that lead to bad rebirths, and in not being a suitable vessel for the teachings.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos bsten pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa las mi lta ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos bsten pa dang / gzhan gyis smad pa las mi lta ste /
translated: One does not see the harm in engaging in obstacles, in being despised by others, and in not being a suitable vessel for the teachings.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos bsten pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nag @183b po dang /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos bsten pa dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / nag @183b po dang /
translated: One does not see the harm in engaging in obstacles, in virtuous and nonvirtuous actions, in reprehensible and irreproachable actions, in bad and good actions, in dark and bright actions, and in the actions of the lower and higher realms.

original: dkar po'i rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams mi rtogs pa dang / ser sna'i dri mas zil gyis non pa'i sems kyis /
analyzed: dkar po'i rab tu dbye ba dang bcas pa'i rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos rnams mi rtogs pa dang / ser sna'i dri mas zil gyis non pa'i sems kyis /
translated: They do not understand the Dharma of dependent origination together with its distinctions of what is wholesome and what is not.

original: snod spyad dang / yo byad mang po 'chang ba dang / blun zhing blo chung ba shin tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: snod spyad dang / yo byad mang po 'chang ba dang / blun zhing blo chung ba shin tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: They are overcome by the defilement of avarice, and they accumulate many vessels and utensils. They are foolish, of little intelligence, and very confused.

original: bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi stobs 'di dag zil gyis mnan pa dang / rnam par bstsal ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs bdun po kho na yod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdud dang nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi stobs 'di dag zil gyis mnan pa dang / rnam par bstsal ba'i phyir 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs bdun po kho na yod par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that there are only seven powers, such as faith in the noble Dharma and Vinaya, in order to overcome and eliminate these powers of Mara and the defilements.

original: don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos bdun po 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'grib cing /üîΩnub bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos bdun po 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos yongs su 'grib cing / nub bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: These seven dharmas that are adverse to the ultimate Dharma of nirvana are the decline and disappearance of the true Dharma.

original: de dag kyang rgud pa rnam pa gsum du 'dus te /
analyzed: de dag kyang rgud pa rnam pa gsum du 'dus te /
translated: They are also included in three kinds of decline:

original: nye bar spyad pa rgud pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa rgud pa dang / sbyor ba rgud pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar spyad pa rgud pa dang lhag pa'i bsam pa rgud pa dang / sbyor ba rgud pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of enjoyment, the degeneration of superior attitude, and the degeneration of application.

original: de la chos gos la sogs pa bzang po 'dod pa dang / mang po 'dod pa dang / de las byung ba'i longs spyod ni nye bar spyad pa rgud pa'o //üîΩlam dang lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa la /
analyzed: de la chos gos la sogs pa bzang po 'dod pa dang / mang po 'dod pa dang / de las byung ba'i longs spyod ni nye bar spyad pa rgud pa'o // lam dang lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa la /
translated: The degeneration of enjoyment is the desire for fine robes, etc., the desire for many, and the enjoyment that results from that.

original: mngon par yid mi ches pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rgud pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par yid mi ches pa ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rgud pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of superior attitude is the lack of faith in the path, its result, and nirvana.

original: le lo dang brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ni sbyor ba rgud pa'o //üîΩde la nye bar spyad pa rgud pa ni /üîΩchags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: le lo dang brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / 'chal ba'i shes rab ni sbyor ba rgud pa'o // de la nye bar spyad pa rgud pa ni / chags pa mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phyogs so //
translated: The degeneration of application is laziness, forgetfulness, distraction, and false wisdom.üîΩThe degeneration of enjoyment is the side of attachment, the root of nonvirtue.

original: bsam pa dang sbyor ba rgud pa ni gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phyogs so //
analyzed: bsam pa dang sbyor ba rgud pa ni gti mug mi dge ba'i rtsa ba'i phyogs so //
translated: The degeneration of attitude and application is the side of delusion, the root of nonvirtue.

original: de dag las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa ni dkar po'i phyogs yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The side of virtue should be understood as the opposite of those.

original: don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs kyi chos bdun po 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos yongs su mi 'grib cing /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyogs kyi chos bdun po 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos yongs su mi 'grib cing /
translated: These seven factors of the Dharma of the transcendence of suffering, which are the ultimate Dharma, are the complete non-decline of the true Dharma.

original: yun ring du gnas par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yun ring du gnas par gyur pa ste /
translated: They are the long-lasting of the true Dharma.üîΩThey are the wisdom arisen from listening, the wisdom arisen from reflection, the wisdom arisen from meditation, the removal of physical harm, the correct search for material things and the Dharma, and the absence of manifest conceit.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the respect for those who are worthy of respect and the lack of respect for those who are not worthy of respect.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / lus kyi gnod pa bsal ba dang / zang zing dang / chos yang dag par yongs su tshol ba dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang /
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / bsams pa las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / lus kyi gnod pa bsal ba dang / zang zing dang / chos yang dag par yongs su tshol ba dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang /
translated: They are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.

original: gang zag bkur sti bya bar 'os pa dang / bkur sti bya bar 'os pa ma yin pa rnams la /üîΩbkur sti bya ba dang / bkur sti bya ba ma yin @184a * //
analyzed: gang zag bkur sti bya bar 'os pa dang / bkur sti bya bar 'os pa ma yin pa rnams la / bkur sti bya ba dang / bkur sti bya ba ma yin @184a * //
translated: They are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.

original: pa'i bye brag phyed pa'o //üîΩde la thos pa ni ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: pa'i bye brag phyed pa'o // de la thos pa ni ma rtogs pa'i don rtogs par byed pa'o //
translated: They are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.

original: bsam pa ni legs par nges par byas pa'i don la dpyod pa'o //üîΩbsgom pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa ni legs par nges par byas pa'i don la dpyod pa'o //üîΩbsgom pa ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'o //
translated: They are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.üîΩThey are the distinction between those who are worthy of respect and those who are not worthy of respect among individuals.

original: lus kyi gnod pa bsal ba ni spong ba bzod par las su rung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi gnod pa bsal ba ni spong ba bzod par las su rung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The elimination of physical harm is the fitness of patience.

original: zang zing dang / chos yang dag par yongs su tshol ba ni mngon par shes pa myur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing dang / chos yang dag par yongs su tshol ba ni mngon par shes pa myur bar byed pa'o //
translated: The search for the Dharma and material goods is the swiftness of the superknowledges.

original: nga rgyal med pa ni ngan ngon tsam thob pas chog mi shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal med pa ni ngan ngon tsam thob pas chog mi shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The absence of pride is the non-satisfaction with mere attainment.

original: gang zag gi bye brag phyed pa ni /
analyzed: gang zag gi bye brag phyed pa ni /
translated: The distinction of persons is

original: bsod nams che bar grags pa rnams la chags pa med pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba rnams la dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams che bar grags pa rnams la chags pa med pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba rnams la dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: the non-attachment to those renowned for great merit and the delight in those of few desires.

original: bdun po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: bdun po 'di dag ni sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: These seven are the abodes of sentient beings.

original: de dag tu sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rgyun du mngon du gyur par 'jug ste /
analyzed: de dag tu sems can rnams kyi rnam par shes pa rgyun du mngon du gyur par 'jug ste /
translated: In them, the consciousnesses of sentient beings enter and remain continuously.

original: ngan song rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni ma gtogs te /
analyzed: ngan song rnams dang / 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams dang / 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni ma gtogs te /
translated: Except for the unfortunate realms, the beings of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and the beings of the base of non-perception.

original: ngan song rnams ni skyo ba'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngan song rnams ni skyo ba'i gzhi'i gnas su gyur pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: The lower realms are not a station of consciousness because they are the basis of distress.

original: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni de na gcig tu nges par rnam par shes pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir na ma yin no //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i sems can rnams ni de na gcig tu nges par rnam par shes pa kun du 'byung ba med pa'i phyir na ma yin no //
translated: The beings without ideation are not a station of consciousness because consciousness is interrupted there for a long time.

original: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni kun du rgyu ba dang / kun du rgyu ba med pa gcig tu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched ni kun du rgyu ba dang / kun du rgyu ba med pa gcig tu nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The station of neither ideation nor non-ideation is not a station of consciousness because it is not determined as either a place of ideation or a place of non-ideation.

original: de la lus mi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de la lus mi 'dra ba ste /
translated: There, the body is not the same,

original: lus sna tshogs dang / 'du shes mi 'dra ba ste 'du shes sna tshogs dang / de las bzlog pa ni lus 'dra ba dang / 'du shes 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lus sna tshogs dang / 'du shes mi 'dra ba ste 'du shes sna tshogs dang / de las bzlog pa ni lus 'dra ba dang / 'du shes 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: that is, the body is various, and the ideation is not the same, that is, the ideation is various. The opposite of that is the body being the same and the ideation being the same.

original: de la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad ni lus mi 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshangs pa'i 'jig rten man chad ni lus mi 'dra ba ste /
translated: Below the world of Brahma, the body is not the same,

original: lus kyi rang bzhin gyi tshul rnam pa sna tshogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin gyi tshul rnam pa sna tshogs su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the mode of the body is born in various ways.

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na ni der thog mar mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten na ni der thog mar mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de dag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: In the Brahma world, those who are born there first think:

original: bdag cag ni tshangs pas bskyed do snyam mo //
analyzed: bdag cag ni tshangs pas bskyed do snyam mo //
translated: Brahma has generated us.

original: tshangs pa yang 'di snyam du 'di dag ni bdag gis bskyed do snyam ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa yang 'di snyam du 'di dag ni bdag gis bskyed do snyam ste /
translated: Brahma also thinks: They have been generated by me.

original: de ltar na de dag ni 'du shes 'dra'o //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni 'du shes 'dra'o //
translated: Thus their ideation is similar.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad ni thams cad kyang lus 'od 'dra ba @184b yin pas /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa yan chad ni thams cad kyang lus 'od 'dra ba @184b yin pas /
translated: In the second absorption and above, all have bodies that are similar to light.

original: lus 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lus 'dra ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called those who have similar bodies.

original: 'od gsal gyi lha'i gnas ni na snga phyir skyes pa rnams /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi lha'i gnas ni na snga phyir skyes pa rnams /
translated: In the abode of the gods of clear light, those who are born there earlier or later

original: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten tshig pa'i me lce mthong ba las 'jigs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur bas /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'jig rten tshig pa'i me lce mthong ba las 'jigs pa dang / mi 'jigs pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur bas /
translated: see the flames of the burning Brahma world and have the ideation of fear and nonfear.

original: de dag ni 'du shes mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'du shes mi 'dra bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, their ideation is known to be dissimilar.

original: sems can rnams kyi gnas ngan len bdun gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad bsdus par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi gnas ngan len bdun gyis ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len thams cad bsdus par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the seven negative reflex actions of sentient beings include all negative reflex actions on the side of affliction.

original: khams ngan pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gi phyogs dang / khams 'bring ba dang / gya nom pa'i 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang / khams ngan pa dang / 'bring dang / gya nom pa'i nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang /
analyzed: khams ngan pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang gi phyogs dang / khams 'bring ba dang / gya nom pa'i 'dod chags kyi phyogs dang / khams ngan pa dang / 'bring dang / gya nom pa'i nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang / lta ba dang /
translated: The negative tendencies of the negative, middling, and excellent aspects of desire, anger, pride, ignorance, views,

original: the tshom gyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len to //
analyzed: the tshom gyi phyogs kyi gnas ngan len to //
translated: and doubt.

original: rnam pa bdun gyis ni 'di la phyi rol pa rnams kyi nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba skyon dang bcas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyis ni 'di la phyi rol pa rnams kyi nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba skyon dang bcas par rig par bya ste /
translated: By seven aspects, the heretical Dharma and Vinaya should be known as having faults:

original: rtogs pa'i skyon dang / spyod pa'i skyon dang / rten gyi skyon dang / rtog pa'i skyon dang / 'bad pa'i skyon dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi skyon dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi skyon no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i skyon dang / spyod pa'i skyon dang / rten gyi skyon dang / rtog pa'i skyon dang / 'bad pa'i skyon dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi skyon dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi skyon no //
translated: the fault of understanding, the fault of practice, the fault of basis, the fault of imagination, the fault of striving, the fault of higher thought, and the fault of higher insight.

original: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams ni thos pa 'dzin par byed du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa rnams ni thos pa 'dzin par byed du zin kyang /
translated: Even though the non-Buddhists retain what they hear,

original: de dag ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang mthun pa'i phyir dang / klan ka tshol ba dang / de lta bu smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon gyi gtan tsam du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni phyin ci log rnam pa bzhi dang mthun pa'i phyir dang / klan ka tshol ba dang / de lta bu smra ba las thar pa'i phan yon gyi gtan tsam du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because they are in accord with the four errors, and because they are only a pretext for liberation from the search for faultfinding and from the teaching of such a path.

original: de dag gis byas pa rtogs pa ni skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis byas pa rtogs pa ni skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The realization of what is done by them is faulty.

original: tshul khrims ni cho ga dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas yongs su zin pa dang / rang gis nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni cho ga dang / 'tsho ba nyams pas yongs su zin pa dang / rang gis nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Morality is faulty because it is taken hold of by the degeneration of ritual and livelihood, and because it does not liberate oneself.

original: mdza' bshes ni phyin ci log gi lam ston pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: mdza' bshes ni phyin ci log gi lam ston pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Friends are faulty because they teach a path that is erroneous.

original: dben pa ni log par rtog pas sems nyams pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni log par rtog pas sems nyams pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Solitude is faulty because the mind is degenerated by false imagination.

original: 'bad pa ni thabs med pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa ni thabs med pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Exertion is faulty because it is without means.

original: lhag pa'i sems ni brjed ngas pa dang / sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang // the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems ni brjed ngas pa dang / sred pa dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa dang // the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa yin pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The superior mind is defective because of the predominance of forgetfulness, craving, pride, ignorance, and doubt in the meditator.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab ni lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi nyams pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab ni lta bar gyur pa drug cu rtsa gnyis kyi nyams pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The superior wisdom is defective because of the sixty-two convictions.

original: @185a * // de dag las bzlog pa ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la gzhi bdun po 'di dag nyid skyon med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: @185a * // de dag las bzlog pa ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la gzhi bdun po 'di dag nyid skyon med par rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of these seven defects in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya should be understood as the seven bases.

original: chos bdun po 'di dag ni dge slong rnams kyi ltung ba byung ba'i rtsod pa zhi bar byed par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: chos bdun po 'di dag ni dge slong rnams kyi ltung ba byung ba'i rtsod pa zhi bar byed par 'gyur ba ste /

original: lhag ma ni 'di lta ste /üîΩgzhi bsdu ba las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni 'di lta ste / gzhi bsdu ba las byung ba yin no //
translated: The rest is as found in the Vinaya.

original: de la bdun po 'di dag ni ltung ba'i rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: de la bdun po 'di dag ni ltung ba'i rtsod pa ste /
translated: Here, the seven are the disputes that arise from downfalls.

original: ltung ba mngon du bsgo bas rtsod pa dang / 'das pa brjed pa'i ltung ba bsgo bas rtsod pa dang / rang dbang med pa'i ltung ba bsgo bas rtsod pa dang / ltung ba brtags pas rtsod pa dang / ltung ba gtan la 'bebs pas rtsod pa dang /
analyzed: ltung ba mngon du bsgo bas rtsod pa dang / 'das pa brjed pa'i ltung ba bsgo bas rtsod pa dang / rang dbang med pa'i ltung ba bsgo bas rtsod pa dang / ltung ba brtags pas rtsod pa dang / ltung ba gtan la 'bebs pas rtsod pa dang /
translated: dispute about the determination of an offense,üîΩdispute about regret for an offense,

original: bdag nyid kyis ltung ba la 'gyod pa rtsod pa dang / phyogs gzhan gyi phyogs su gnas pa phan tshun ltung ba gleng ba mi bzod pas rtsod pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis ltung ba la 'gyod pa rtsod pa dang / phyogs gzhan gyi phyogs su gnas pa phan tshun ltung ba gleng ba mi bzod pas rtsod pa'o //
translated: and dispute about the mutual intolerance of those who live in a faction of the Sa·πÖgha that is in disagreement.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas bdun bdun pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka'i shes bya'i gnas bdun bdun pa rdzogs so /
translated: The seven topics of the Buddha‚Äôs word are complete.

original: // / kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / kun du sbyor ba ma lus par spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon all fetters,

original: dge slong gis bsgom pa yan lag brgyad kyis bsdus pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis bsgom pa yan lag brgyad kyis bsdus pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: a monk should know three things that are included in the eight-branched meditation:üîΩthe meditation of morality,üîΩthe meditation of concentration,

original: tshul khrims bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang / shes rab bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsgom pa dang / ting nge 'dzin bsgom pa dang / shes rab bsgom pa'o //
translated: and the meditation of wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams kyis ni tshul khrims bsgom mo//
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ngag dang / las kyi mtha' dang / 'tsho ba rnams kyis ni tshul khrims bsgom mo//
translated: One cultivates morality through right speech, right action, and right livelihood.

original: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyis ni ting nge 'dzin bsgom mo //
translated: One cultivates meditative concentration through right mindfulness and right meditative concentration.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / rtsol ba rnams kyis ni shes rab bsgom mo //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / rtog pa dang / rtsol ba rnams kyis ni shes rab bsgom mo //
translated: One cultivates wisdom through right view, right thought, and right effort.

original: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi gang zag brgyad rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i sbyor ba 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par byang ba'i phyogs kyi gang zag brgyad rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The eight persons who are on the side of purification should be understood as being posited from the perspective of the correct application that has results.

original: zhugs pa bzhi dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa bzhi dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
translated: There are four who have entered and four who have achieved results.

original: skyon dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa dang / skyon med pa'i sbyin pa 'di gnyis ni rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: skyon dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa dang / skyon med pa'i sbyin pa 'di gnyis ni rnam pa brgyad du rig par bya ste /
translated: Generosity with faults and generosity without faults should be understood as being of eight types.

original: de la rnam pa bdun gyi skyon dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam pa bdun gyi skyon dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Among them, the seven types have faults.

original: rnam pa gcig ni skyon dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig ni skyon dang bral ba'o //
translated: The one type is without faults.

original: sbyin pa le los nyams par gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sbyin pa le los nyams par gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: Generosity is impaired by laziness.

original: skyon dang bcas pa 'ang yod /
analyzed: skyon dang bcas pa 'ang yod /
translated: There is also generosity that is faulty.

original: zang zing gi sems dbul gyis 'jigs pa dang / dbang phyug 'dod de mi 'dod bzhin du byed pas skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /üîΩ'das pa la lta ba'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
analyzed: zang zing gi sems dbul gyis 'jigs pa dang / dbang phyug 'dod de mi 'dod bzhin du byed pas skyon dang bcas pa yang yod / 'das pa la lta ba'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
translated: There is generosity that is faulty due to fear of poverty, and generosity that is faulty due to desire for lordship, since one gives unwillingly.üîΩThere is generosity that is faulty due to attachment to the result of giving in this life.

original: @185b ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
analyzed: @185b ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
translated: There is generosity that is faulty due to attachment to the result of giving in a future life.

original: brnyas pa'i skyon gyis skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /üîΩgrags pa 'dod pa'i skyon gyis skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
analyzed: brnyas pa'i skyon gyis skyon dang bcas pa yang yod / grags pa 'dod pa'i skyon gyis skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
translated: There is generosity that is faulty due to the fault of contempt.üîΩThere is generosity that is faulty due to the fault of desiring fame.

original: longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
analyzed: longs spyod 'dod pa'i phyir skyon dang bcas pa yang yod /
translated: There is generosity that is faulty due to desire for wealth.

original: skyon med pa'i sbyin pa ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bsngos la /
analyzed: skyon med pa'i sbyin pa ni zang zing med pa'i sems kyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das par bsngos la /
translated: Generosity that is faultless is that which is dedicated to complete nirvana with a mind free of material desires,

original: de'i tshogs su yang gyur bzhin du bde 'gror yang 'gro ba dang / longs spyod chen por yang 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i tshogs su yang gyur bzhin du bde 'gror yang 'gro ba dang / longs spyod chen por yang 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and which, while being a collection of that, leads to happy rebirths and great wealth.

original: gnas bzhi la brten nas /
analyzed: gnas bzhi la brten nas /
translated: Based on four bases,

original: dus brgyad du le lo byad par ston te /
analyzed: dus brgyad du le lo byad par ston te /
translated: It is taught that laziness is shown in eight times.

original: brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa ni /
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa ni /
translated: Laziness is not being diligent.

original: gang zag 'di ni le lo'i rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: gang zag 'di ni le lo'i rang bzhin can te /
translated: This person is lazy by nature.

original: brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa'i rang bzhin can yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus mi rtsom pa'i rang bzhin can yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that he is lazy by nature.üîΩIt is based on four things:

original: bsod snyoms la brten pa dang / 'di lta bu bya ba dang / rgyu zhing 'gro ba dang / khams mi mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la brten pa dang / 'di lta bu bya ba dang / rgyu zhing 'gro ba dang / khams mi mnyam pa'o //
translated: 1. relying on alms, 2. doing this and that, 3. traveling around, and 4. imbalance of the elements.

original: gnas bzhi po 'di dag la brten nas /
analyzed: gnas bzhi po 'di dag la brten nas /
translated: Based on these four things,

original: kha zas bsod pa dang / mang ba zos pas lus lci bar gyur pa'i dus dang / kha zas nyung la ngan pa zos pas lus rmya ba'i dus dang / 'di lta bu bya bar sbyor 'dod de /
analyzed: kha zas bsod pa dang / mang ba zos pas lus lci bar gyur pa'i dus dang / kha zas nyung la ngan pa zos pas lus rmya ba'i dus dang / 'di lta bu bya bar sbyor 'dod de /
translated: there are eight times: the time when the body is heavy because of eating good and plentiful food, the time when the body is emaciated because of eating little and bad food, the time when one wants to engage in doing this and that,

original: nyams stobs sri ba'i dus dang / 'di lta bu bya ba byas nas ngal so ba'i dus dang / rgyu zhing 'gro 'dod de nyams stobs sri ba'i dus dang / slar log nas lam gyis dub pa ngal so ba'i dus dang / nad kyis btab ste /
analyzed: nyams stobs sri ba'i dus dang / 'di lta bu bya ba byas nas ngal so ba'i dus dang / rgyu zhing 'gro 'dod de nyams stobs sri ba'i dus dang / slar log nas lam gyis dub pa ngal so ba'i dus dang / nad kyis btab ste /
translated: the time when one is tired from doing this and that, the time when one wants to travel around and is tired, the time when one is tired from returning, the time when one is sick,üîΩand the time when one is not sick.

original: nad kyi sdug bsngal ba dang phrad pa'i dus dang / nad sos nas phyir ltas dogs pa'i dus te /
analyzed: nad kyi sdug bsngal ba dang phrad pa'i dus dang / nad sos nas phyir ltas dogs pa'i dus te /
translated: When one encounters the suffering of illness and when one is cured of illness and fears a relapse.

original: de ltar gang zag le le'i rang bzhin can de ni le lo'i rkyen dang ma phrad pa'i bar du ni di brtson 'grus byed pa tsam du snang la gang gi tshe phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni myur ba myur bar de la lo ston par 'gyur te
analyzed: de ltar gang zag le le'i rang bzhin can de ni le lo'i rkyen dang ma phrad pa'i bar du ni di brtson 'grus byed pa tsam du snang la gang gi tshe phrad par gyur pa de'i tshe ni myur ba myur bar de la lo ston par 'gyur te
translated: Thus, the person who is by nature lazy appears to be diligent as long as he does not encounter the conditions for laziness. But when he encounters them, he quickly shows his laziness.

original: / de lta bas na le lo'i rang bzhin can zhes bya'o //üîΩde las bzlog pa ni gnas bzhi po de dag nyid la brten nas /
analyzed: / de lta bas na le lo'i rang bzhin can zhes bya'o // de las bzlog pa ni gnas bzhi po de dag nyid la brten nas /
translated: Therefore, he is called ‚Äúone who is by nature lazy.‚Äù

original: dus brgyad po de dag nyid kyi tshe brtson 'grus rtsom zhing le lo zil gyis gnon pas /
analyzed: dus brgyad po de dag nyid kyi tshe brtson 'grus rtsom zhing le lo zil gyis gnon pas /
translated: The opposite of that is the person who is by nature diligent. He is diligent in the eight periods of the day and night and overcomes laziness.

original: gang zag brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: He is known as ‚Äúone who is by nature diligent.‚Äù

original: de ni la lo'i rkyen dang phrad pa'i tshe yang brtson 'grus rtsom na /
analyzed: de ni la lo'i rkyen dang phrad pa'i tshe yang brtson 'grus rtsom na /
translated: Even when he encounters the conditions for laziness, he is diligent.

original: ma phrad pa'i tshe lta ci smos te /
analyzed: ma phrad pa'i tshe lta ci smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention when he does not encounter them?

original: de lta bas na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rang @186a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i rang @186a * //
translated: Therefore, one should make effort.üîΩ

original: bzhin can zhes bya'o //üîΩyid du 'ong bar skye ba'i rgyu yang dag pa'i smon lam gyis zin pa brgyad po 'di dag ni 'dod pa dag la mngon par mtho bar 'dod cing /
analyzed: bzhin can zhes bya'o // yid du 'ong bar skye ba'i rgyu yang dag pa'i smon lam gyis zin pa brgyad po 'di dag ni 'dod pa dag la mngon par mtho bar 'dod cing /
translated: Thus, it is called the nature of the practice of effort.üîΩThe eight causes of a pleasant rebirth are the eight types of pleasant rebirths that are the result of pure aspiration.üîΩThey are the result of pure aspiration and are the result of the practice of effort.

original: 'dod pa las dben pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'dod pa rnams yid du 'ong ba'i gnas rnam pa brgyad du skye bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa las dben pa thams cad kyi thams cad du mi 'dod pa rnams yid du 'ong ba'i gnas rnam pa brgyad du skye bar byed pa ste /
translated: The eight types of pleasant rebirth are:

original: mi skal ba ngan par smon lam btab pa ni /
analyzed: mi skal ba ngan par smon lam btab pa ni /
translated: 1. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for a bad destiny,

original: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba chung ngu yin no //
translated: 2. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for a good destiny,üîΩ3. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for the realm of the Four Great Kings,üîΩ4. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for the Heaven of the Thirty-three,

original: de bzhin du mi skal ba bzang po dang / rgyal chen bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhar smon lam btab pa yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du mi skal ba bzang po dang / rgyal chen bzhi dang / sum cu rtsa gsum pa dang / 'thab bral dang / dga' ldan dang / 'phrul dga' dang / gzhan 'phrul dbang byed kyi lhar smon lam btab pa yang /
translated: 5. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for the Yama Heaven,üîΩ6. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for the Tushita Heaven,üîΩ7. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for the Nirmanarati Heaven, andüîΩ8. the rebirth of one who has made an aspiration for the Paranirmitavasavartin Heaven.

original: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba chung ngu yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa las byung ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba chung ngu yin no //
translated: The first two are small in terms of generosity and morality.

original: rgyu bzhis ni mi rnams kyi nang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu bzhis ni mi rnams kyi nang na de bzhin gshegs pa'i 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four retinues of the Tathagata are established among humans by four causes.üîΩThe four retinues of the gods are established by three causes.

original: rgyu gsum gyis lhar gyur pa rnams kyi 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis lhar gyur pa rnams kyi 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The four retinues of the gods are established by three causes:

original: bdag po'i mchog tu gyur pa dang / yon gnas su bkur ba dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa'i longs spyod kyis 'tsho ba dang / longs spyod yang dag par spangs pas 'tsho ba'i rgyu 'di bzhis ni /
analyzed: bdag po'i mchog tu gyur pa dang / yon gnas su bkur ba dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa'i longs spyod kyis 'tsho ba dang / longs spyod yang dag par spangs pas 'tsho ba'i rgyu 'di bzhis ni /
translated: being the supreme lord, being revered as a field of merit, living with wealth that is not dependent on others, and living by abandoning wealth.

original: mir gyur pa'i nang nas 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mir gyur pa'i nang nas 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four retinues are established among humans by these four causes.

original: sa gzhi la brten pa'i mthar gyur pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthar gyur pa dang / ngag gi 'du byed kyi mthar gyur pa'i phyir ni lhar gyur pa rnams kyi 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa gzhi la brten pa'i mthar gyur pa dang / 'dod pa'i khams kyi mthar gyur pa dang / ngag gi 'du byed kyi mthar gyur pa'i phyir ni lhar gyur pa rnams kyi 'khor bzhir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The four assemblies of the gods are established as the end of the earth, the end of the desire realm, and the end of verbal formations.

original: 'jig rten gnas gsum la gnas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gnas gsum la gnas na /
translated: When beings dwell in the three abodes of the world,

original: 'jig rten dag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par chos brgyad dang phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dag rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par chos brgyad dang phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: they constantly and continuously encounter the eight worldly phenomena.

original: 'dod pa dang / 'bad pa dang / rkyen rnams la'o //üîΩ'dod pa gnas na ni rnyed pa dang yang phrad la /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang / 'bad pa dang / rkyen rnams la'o // 'dod pa gnas na ni rnyed pa dang yang phrad la /
translated: Desire, striving, and conditions.üîΩWhen dwelling in desire, one encounters gain and loss.üîΩWhen dwelling in striving, one encounters praise and blame.üîΩWhen dwelling in conditions, one encounters pleasure and pain.üîΩWhen dwelling in desire, one encounters gain and loss.
